description:
The food was amazing there! We especially loved the Kunming Lamb and the Hunan Butter Beef. Highly recommend those two. 

Also, the owner Xiaochuan is a master on Hip-Hop music and Freestyling. He's also super chill and very nice to talk to. If you are into Hip-Hop culture, you should definitely come here, order some food and chat with Xiaochuan. You'll be amazed!!
author: Tracy L.

description:
"...There was funky Billy Chin and little Sammy Chung..

He said here comes the big boss, let's get it on..

We took a bow and made a stand, started swinging with the hand..

The sudden motion made me skip now we're into a brand knew trip..

Everybody was kung-fu fighting
Those kicks were fast as lightning..."

Ahh that funky disco song! But first...

Get the lunch special! Thank me later! 

Where: Kung Food, Western Addition, SF, CA. 

Get the lunch special! Upgrade to fried rice! 

Get the lunch special! Be one happy Panda! 

Wow! What a bargain at $8.50 + $1 fried rice upgrade for a tasty Chinese lunch with no MSG! 

I've been to Kung Food a few times since stumbling upon it in the Western Addition. Hey, its "almost" as good as Disco and that funky song! Such a cute name and a cute panda logo! Dare I say it just might be my go-to lunch spot in the city! I had the sweet & sour pork and loved it! Soup included. I had the lemon chicken and loved it too. I've had other lunch specials since then and all fresh, all good. 

Kung Food is a casual café style Chinese restaurant specializing in Cantonese food. Of all Chinese foods I'd say Cantonese is my favorite and probably due to my low tolerance of spicy. I'm just used to it! 

I guess if I rated Kung Food after my first, second, third visit I'd give them a perfect 5-Stars! Yet, on my last visit my experience was closer to meh, for starters the food didn't seem on point (different cook?), the chubby hostess seemed melancholy lol, and after my meal I didn't get my Fortune Cookie *sad panda* Hmm so 4-Stars, I guess! 

In the end, I'd still recommend Kung Food to anyone in the Western Addition area. And of course, if you just can't get to Chinatown. Kung Food offers a nice affordable alternative if in Western Addition. Again, go with the lunch special! Just remind the waitress of your Fortune Cookie later... she just might be more into Billy Chin or worse... Chinese Morrissey!

"Everybody was kung-food fighting..."
author: Eric R.

description:
Food is just meh. Placed an order and went at the appointed time to pick up. Told to wait just a few more minutes as there were orders ahead. Went outside to wait since I thought it'd just be a "few more minutes." Went back in and heard the same story. Really disappointed in the lack of care and service. I was standing right there... you'd think there'd be a sense of urgency in preparing my order, or maybe getting it to me sooner than later.

I'd give this place a miss, unless you like your mediocre, generically greasy Chinese food with a hefty dose of "I don't care about you."
author: Milk and Cheese ..

description:
Kung Food is a good, no-fuss Chinese restaurant.  When I'm looking for Chinese restaurants, all I really care about are two things: quality of food, speed, and price, and Kung Food hits all of those three.

The restaurant itself isn't too large, but when we came around 5pm on a Sunday, we ordered and got our food within 10 minutes.  As with most Chinese restaurants, the menu is pretty extensive, which means that there are some great items, but also some worth avoiding.  We ordered the chicken fried rice and the Hunan chicken.  The fried rice was great -- classic and nothing too fancy.  I wouldn't recommend the Hunan chicken; it came with a lot of sauce but nothing too distinguishing in flavor, and a random assortment of vegetables which wasn't too appealing to me.  Still, looking at some of the other dishes at nearby tables that looked delicious, I think we just made a bad call on ordering it.

Overall, good Chinese restaurant and probably will become my go-to takeout place in the area.
author: Kelsey P.

description:
By far the best Chinese food I have had in San Francisco (or anywhere else for that matter) - and it wasn't even in China town. The restaurant is a small, quaint place traditionally decorated. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. 

Pork Wontons, Crab Rangoon , Pork Pot Stickers were outstanding. The Pork Potstickers were the best dumplings I ever had. We also had the Korean Fried Chicken, Mongolian Beef and Sweet and Sour Prawns. Serving sizes were large and everything was delicious!  Would go back in a heartbeat!  If I lived here - I would be here every week at the minimum. Great place!
author: Patrick A.

description:
Ugh. I REALLY want to like this place because it's family owned, affordable and is the only Chinese in our neighborhood.
I have gone here half a dozen times and each time there is something glaringly wrong.
First off, not knowing how to make Egg Foo Yung is unacceptable if you offer it on your menu.
Having gummy wontons in wonton soup is also not ok.
Today I ordered walnut prawns and there were THREE walnuts. Also the egg fried rice that was $1 extra was completely without flavor.
You'd think after so many visits I'd finally get the clue and stop going, but I'm still hopeful that after so many years they'll improve.
author: D C.

description:
I needed to grab a quick lunch while on break at WorkshopSF and I came across this place. Delicious and super inexpensive, I was pleasantly surprised. It's a bit far from where I live, but I was glad to see that deliver-- I will definitely want to order from this place next time I'm craving Chinese food.

Also ps: great place for vegetarians!
author: Grace P.

description: Kung Food is quick, reliable Chinese take-out. Good food. Very generous portions. One dish is generally 1.5-2 meals for me. The dragon beef was tasty. I don't have much to say, this is go-to Chinese food that I will frequent often.
author: Neil S.

description:
Big ol portion ordered it for lunch for my daughter and girlfriend. One of the few places that actually has a lunch menu for delivery. I cant write anymore it looks wayy too good will update *non nom nom* soon. Sorry had to eat couldnt wait any longer 

Update 10 seconds after:

That feeling you get when u felt like u haven't eaten in a while and stuff ur face so bad well yeah this food hits the spot. Cannot believe I never checked out this place earlier. My daughter loves the food.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Who can resist not at least checking out a place with such a creative name lol?let me just say how ecstatic and extremely happy I was in this place since I don't usually review restaurants because for people who crave for food you would just go eat there even they don't have decent services, not only the food is super healthy & delicious by far the best, the price is fairly also the owner is very friendly and chill he is the famous/popular China rap star due to his awesome performance in "the rap of China " show 
we enjoyed it so much you just can't find anything like that in other restaurants. Highly recommend!
author: Allen L.

description: I hate how restaurants get so lazy with delivery items because they can't be sent back. Got an order of chow fun - but they never bothered to separate the noodles so it was more like think blocks of starch with little sauce. Suffice it to say that it didn't get eaten and was tossed.  Please stop being lazy.
author: reza n.

description:
Ordered delivery from this place, and it came right on time.  The food was OK.  Green beans with tofu were good, but very oily.  The chow fun and won ton soup were less good--the noodles in the chow fun especially were overly soy sauced.  Dumplings were great.

My main problem with them is that their online prices include a $1 extra charge on several dishes that they include for delivery, which I only learned once I noticed the difference in prices with the menu they handed me with the delivery.  I wouldn't have ordered with them had I known they were doing that.

EDIT: In response to the business's comments, I agree that nothing is free but that wasn't my issue. The issue is that the fee is not disclosed--you disclose one delivery fee (25 cents) but in actuality charge another, higher, delivery fee. Just tell the customers about the real delivery fee.
author: Aaron S.

description:
2 hour late delivery. 

Ordered dinner at the end of a party. A few minutes after the estimated delivery time, the restaurant called to inform us that they were out of one of the dishes. I should have used this opportunity to cancel because by the time food came, everyone had given up and left. Unfortunately the only thing that tasted good reheated was the tofu with black mushroom. Everything else went to waste.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Who would have thought that the NOPA area, McAllister and Divisadero Street to be exact, have a pretty good Chinese restaurant? I certainly didn't think so. But that area has change positively every day. 

I also heard and read on our beloved website, that this restaurant has really good lunch specials. And you thought that I rely heavily on a burrito and an Oscar Mayer bologna sandwich (not all on one serving) for lunch!?! 

I was here last month and twice within a week, both times checking out the lunch specials.  The lunch specials range from $7.50-$9.95. My first visit, I was hungry and ordered the Mongolian lamb over rice. For $9.95, the spicy dish has lean and grilled lamb meat, spicy peppers, onions and extra heat. Every lunch specials comes with a complimentary egg roll. You can also choose white rice, brown or fried rice, both at extra cost.   I like any spicy Mongolian rice dishes, the restaurant's version is very good with the grilled lamb a difference maker. This dish is classified as spicy, but this dish is tolerable for wimps. 

I also ordered a side of chicken wings. The chicken wings were just okay with overly excessive amount of batter. Plus, it was an overkill with the hefty and large rice plate. They say, "my eyes are bigger than my stomach" It definitely shows. But I struggled and finished both dishes anyway. 

My second visit came a few days later. I ordered Dragon beef over rice. For $8.95, the beef was slightly fried with a hint of Hunan-blended spices. The dish is very mild with a tangy taste of Hunan flavor. I also like this dish too. 

The restaurant is really small and is located on the McAllister street side and not the busy Divisadero corridor side. The workers were really nice and treated Joe Cool like a king.
author: Matt G.

description:
I was so disappointed with Kung Food when I came here on a Saturday night. I understand that it's not a genuine authentic Chinese restaurant, but when I ordered their twice cooked pork, it was literally bbq pork with some vegetables - cabbage, carrots, bell peppers, and onions. It wasn't even twice cooked, which really defeats the dish's name and was misleading. 

The chow mein was pretty tasty, but a little oily. I lost my appetite after the twice cooked pork dish came out. The ambiance was nice however, a little distracting with the staff changing the music constantly to various artists and music genres.
author: Ada C.

description: Small little spot. Delicious Chinese food. Great prices. Gluten Free friendly! They keep gluten free tamari soy sauce on hand and are happy to modify a dish to make it gluten free. I ordered the veggie chow fun and the dim sum shrimp dumplings! Both were super yummy. Gluten eating hubby ordered the chow mein and sweet and sour Chix lunch special, which also came with soup and an egg roll. He loved it! We will definitely be back.
author: Crystal H.

description:
Best Chinese Food in SF in my opinion! If you're looking for a specific cuisine, Szechuan, Hong Kong, etc. you're better off looking for another authentic restaurant. But Kung Food was my GO-TO when I lived in SF ;) great hot, piping Chinese food, portions are HUGE, and delivery was spot on.

By random chance, I Yelped the nearest Chinese food delivery and Kung Fu popped up on the Eat24 radar. Ordering from them multiple times, I've tried yang chow fried rice, chow mein, honey walnut shrimp, and Mongolian beef. The quantity was hearty-- enough for next day leftovers. And quality was delicious! It wasn't overly oily or doused in MSG (trust, I'd die after huge MSG intakes). The food and proteins were fresh, which makes sense cause they're so busy popular.

One time, I swung by to grab take-out. The interior ambiance was very low-key yet clean and pristine. I was immensely impressed. Seemed like a family-run operation so the workers were very casual. The only gripe is of course street parking. But totally worth the stopover if you're craving comfort Chinese food! I miss you Kung Food!!!
author: Donna T.

description:
10 bucks for lunch deal, can't go wrong!!! 

Things taste fresh and delicious, I would easily come back. After dinner go across the street for some Kava and chill.

I've tried green beans and beef, orange chicken, mushrooms and fake chicken, basil fake chicken, and hot and sour soup. All things were good, felt satisfied each and every time.

A real place with a real food. Stay real Kung Food.
author: Auza A.

description: This was beyond terrible. Everything tasted like it was reheated. We spent $75 dollars on take out and the food wasn't edible, there was also a curly hair in the prawns we ordered. Frankly, I'm insulted that a place like this would even call themselves a restaurant. Save yourself the pretty penny.
author: Monica M.

description: *negative* Had Postmates. As we were cleaning up for the night and was going to put away leftovers, my boyfriend noticed something stuck inside the food container. See pic. Yes, it is some kind of a pest, he said it looks like a cockroach. I can't believe it. We didn't notice it since it seems to be stuck in between the grooves of the container and once opened, it camouflaged on our black table. It is dead and stuck on its back (how it's stuck on its back? IDK). What do we do about this? I have never experienced anything like this before. All I could think of is all that food I ate. Was there any inside the food we ate? Are we going to get sick now? We're researching what it is that we need to do. Obviously, this needs to be reported. Just LETTING YOU (future customers) ALL KNOW THAT THIS HAPPENED.
author: Erica R.

description: This food was extremely hit or miss- we were honestly surprised that the menu said no MSG cause we could have sworn some of the food tasted so good it could have only been made with MSG- but what do we know!! We ordered the small hot and sour soup, green onion pancakes, vegetable chowmein and sweet and sour chicken. The hot and sour soup was really bad- it left a strange aftertaste in our mouths, the egg was rubbery and the vegetables tasted like the chemicals and pesticides hadn't been washed off. The green onion pancakes were also disappointing, they were crispy on the outside and on the inside, the flavor was bland and there were not enough green onions. Now for the good food- the chowmein was DELICIOUS!! The vegetables and noodles were so good we honestly thought they had to have MSG. The sweet and sour chicken was also good, especially with the chowmein. The sauce was nice, although the chicken was chewy it was still good. I would come here again for the chowmein but might try other food with it.
author: Kulmeher D.

description: Fair price , decent portion and amazing services, thumbs up. I found great food and friendly service and a great price. You can never go wrong with the classic orange chicken, beef chow main and Mongolian beef.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
The literal translation for Kung Fu is time spent at skillful work. Change the U to a double O and a D to create the words Kung Food? Oh it's a done deal. The Shaolin monks, themselves, would approve of such mastery. 

First of all, Chinese takeout is usually pretty greasy, laden with MSG, and not of the greatest quality; however, it fills the belly and it's cheap. 

Here at Kung Food, you get the freshest ingredients AND affordability. 

I highly recommend their lunch specials. You get an entree with a side of steamed white rice or for an extra dollar you can opt for egg fried rice, veggie chow mein, or brown rice. Soup and an egg roll are also included for free. All of this for $8.50. 

Entrees that I've tried here thus far:

Mongolian Beef - tender slices of beef sautéed with bell peppers and green onions along with whole red chili peppers. This dish is especially good because the sauce is not overpowering and the meat is cooked to perfection. The veggies are not served limp, and they remain crisp and light with every bite. 

Curry Chicken - I ordered this as spicy, and it came out surprisingly balanced. The cuts of chicken were moist and the curry flavor was prominent without being overwhelming. 

Honey Walnut Prawns - These babies are so juicy and plump, they pop in your mouth. The sauce is creamy, slightly sweet, and savory, yet not heavily doused in oil. The candied walnuts dusted with sesame seeds played a supportive role in rounding out this dish. 

Orange Chicken - Citrusy with a hint of tangy and a touch of sweetness, I was relieved to see that this common dish was not over-fried and dry.  

Kung Food promises outstanding Chinese cuisine, excellent service, and friendly staff; all of which I have personally experienced and can vouch for. 

When it comes to cheap, Chinese takeout, I thing Kung Food is definitely a game changer in the definition of how this food can be perceived. 

5 Stars!
author: Ann S.

description:
Bottom line...delicious.

Called ahead and ordered for dine in.

Was greeted with a smile and courteous service. 
Nice guy.
I noticed he knew a lot of customers who came in after me by their first name. Shows the loyalty from customers for this establishment.

Food was hot and promptly read when we arrived and took a table.

Chicken fried rice and Korean fried wings for me. 5/5

Daughter had sweet and sour chicken with plain chow mein noodles. Delicious.

Love that this Chinese restaurant chicken actually takes like real chicken, not just over Breaded.


Whenever I'm in SF and have a taste for Chinese food, I will be stopping by.
author: michael d.

description: Great lunch special deal for under $9! Lunch special comes with hot & sour soup, entree, egg roll, rice/fried rice (highly recommend!!!)/chow mien. The dry sautéed string beans were fantastic but the beef & broccoli was pretty bland. Hot and sour soup was fine, not great, Fried rice was great!!! Would definitely order delivery or pick up to try the lettuce cups, dim sum, and avocado rolls!
author: Kylie F.

description: Pretty good, better than most chinese place sed but nothing to write home about. If your in the area and need a good hardy bite I'd recommend.
author: Oyuki P.

description:
I ordered takeout on Kung Food's website and left work, hoping my food would be ready once I arrived. It was! 

I got the Mongolian Beef lunch special and requested no white/yellow/red onion. I mentioned that green onions were okay, though. I also requested hot chili oil in a condiment cup, if they had any. And they delivered on both requests. It means a lot when places that are churning out dishes pretty quickly are able to accommodate these types of requests, so I definitely appreciate that. 

The portion size, even for lunch, is quite large, so I was able to make three meals out of it. The beef was tender and flavorful, and it wasn't overly sauce-y or dry.
author: Sarah B.

description:
This is an "Americanized" Chinese food spot, but it was really good!

We got the dragon beef and it was SO crispy without feeling deep fried. I didn't care for the soup that came beforehand, but the beef itself was worth the stop.
author: Michelle B.

description: I ordered walnut shrimp, orange chicken, shrimp chow mein, Korean fried chicken, and chicken fried rice. It was the best Chinese food I have ever had in my life. I had bad walnut shrimp somewhere else, so ever since that experience I was skeptical about ordering it. I do not regret ordering their walnut shrimp!! My only regret is getting one order to share at the table, when I could have eaten the whole order to myself. Orange chicken was crispy, and had perfect combination of orange and sweet/spice. Shrimp chow mein was full of flavor! Didn't taste like burnt oil, like a lot of places. The chicken fried rice was good as well.  Korean fried chicken wings were the best wings I've ever had!! They were double fried and coated in this sauce that was so good. Good enough I actually put some on my rice!! The food came out very fast!!! I loved it!!! BEST CHINESE FOOD EVER!!!
author: Kaylyn R.

description: we came to travel.good fried egg rice ，very delicious.even better than some local  restaurants in  china
author: Bu B.

description: Can't wait to visit this place. Saw the owner on Rap of China and his passion and charisma. I know he's going to put his heart and soul in to everything
author: Chris W.

description:
Updated: I have eaten at Kung Food no fewer than 5x in the past 8 months. I have also referred 2 different friends who have patronised Kung Food on several occasions. This rating is not for the food. I assume the food is still good.

Tonight we decided to go to Kung Food and arrived at the restaurant at 9pm, knowing they close at 9:30. We were immediately greeted by a young man who launched off into telling us they were closing in a half hour. My partner and I discussed doing take out l, mainly because the restaurant was cold. It's a foggy cold and damp evening. 

My partner started to ask the young guy about keeping the restaurant cold and the young man got defensive and I said "F this" and he replied "F U 2." He clearly wasn't listening because "F This," is not personal.

Now this may sound stupid but I know homophobic discrimination when I see it. So, yeah, don't expect a warm greeting from this young guy. It's a shame because we liked the food.

Update: now that the owner has responded with calling me names and for all intents and purposes threatening me... I think his response speaks for itself. If anyone will bring his restaurant down, it will be himself...
author: Bulldog W.

description: Good portions. Quick service at lunch. Will be back. Tasty garlic eggplant with chicken
author: Sharon L.

description: Second time I've gotten take away/delivery and again was disappointed. The flavor is good, but not great. This is also the second time that about 50% of my food was straight onion. If I asked for no onion I have no idea how they'd fill the container! I live within 4 blocks and will not be returning.
author: Christine J.

description:
This place is hit or miss. Unfortunately more miss than hit. And it stinks that it's technically the only Chinese place off Alamo square with out having to take transportation to another hood to get a Chinese food fix. 
I recently got their lunch special and the chicken in the sweet and sour & general's dish were questionable at best. It looked good, however when biting into the chicken it was dry and hard (both dishes!!!!!)
Ever chew on a tooth pick till it splits in your mouth.... that's what the chicken texture was like only covered in heavy sauces. 
Needless to say I threw the "chicken" away and had to eat something else later.
author: K M.

description:
Loved it.  Good people here too.  Andy recommended the Dragon Chicken which is not on the menu and it was wonderful.  Just a hint of heat was incorporated amidst deep fried chicken with stir fried red onions in a slightly sour sauce.  Whoa-- excellent, but so much food!
We also added the amazeballs General Tsao's Chicken, Pot Stickers and Chicken Fried Rice.
It was our first time here and we didn't realize just how big the portions are--whew!
We could have easily ordered and shared either the Dragon Chicken or the General Tsao's Chicken and left full.
Everything was delicious but we wound up going home with 3 cartons of food because the main dishes were so plentiful!
There is no beer or wine on the menu but they are more than happy to have you bring your own in from the corner store right next door.
I really liked the food and vibe here.
Clap! Clap! Clap!
author: Thomas D.

description:
I am on the hunt for crispy fried beef like City Lights Of China in Washington DC serves.  So was interested in the Crispy Dragon Beef served here.  Alas my search continues but....
From the moment we entered this small establishment to order take out, we were warmly greeted and later asked to please sit while our order was being prepared. We ordered the Korean Chicken Wings and Dragon Crispy Beef with fried rice (I could have had chow mein instead of rice and wish I had, to try it).  With the wings, I had hoped for something similar to the dried chicken wings at Shanghai House but within walking distance.  Nope on this one too.  However both dishes especially the beef were quite good.  And your take out lunch comes with egg, roll and soup.  I save my five stars for Eliza's and TuLans but our meal was a good solid 4 plus stars.  Certainly good enough to be put on rotation.  I will get the Dragon beef again and begin to try other things on the menu.  And you know, the big warm smile and welcoming hello really puts a smile on my face too.
author: Vickie B.

description: The food here is awesome as well as the owner! If you love Chinese food, this is definitely the place to go. If you also love hip hop and raps, OMG then trust me there is no  other restaurant in town that's better than here. The owner Xiaochuan is an extremely talented freestyle rapper and a nice and humble person.
author: Michelle L.

description: The food is awesome, and the owner of the restaurant Xiaochuan is a very talented rap artist, had a fantastic experience there
author: Xun X.

description: Wow I'm writing my review as I'm eating my lunch. The honey walnut shrimp I got was sooo fresh, like it was just fried and the sauce was drizzled on it, with crispy walnuts (not stale!). And the egg fried rice that came with it just hit the spot, and the soup came out steamy and satisfying!!! Bomb. Dot. Com.
author: Soo L.

description: So I was visiting San Francisco and decided on this place due to the good reviews and proximity to my hotel. Was impressed! The Broccoli Beef, Peeking Pork Chops, and Fried Rice did not disappoint, and was quite affordable to boot. Highly recommend!
author: Ehsan H.

description: Food here has gone down in quality a lot since they first opened. Maybe they got too busy and they are cutting corners? Prawns were so salty it was like the salt shaker lid fell off when they were seasoning them. I couldn't even eat them and had to spit them out. Other dishes were pretty bland and not flavorful like before. What a disappointment! Will not be going back.
author: M L.

description: Nice food and relatively inexpensive in SF. The owner can freestyle rap for you if you request lol.
author: Yi Y.

description:
If this is the only Chinese place within miles, I would probably give it a begrudging pass. But this is in the city with the oldest Chinatown in the US, the bar must be set much higher.
This is a review of the delivery service.
When we placed the order, the delivery time was 45-60 minutes. We did not get our order for 1:45. This is already a big no-no. The restaurant did not call to let us know the delay.
One of the menu items was the dimsum combination plate. It says on the menu that it includes 2 of each of the items, shrimp dumplings, pork buns and siu mai. So we were expecting 2 shrimp dumplings, 2 pork buns, and 2 siu mai. Imagine our surprise when we found 4 shrimp dumplings, 2 siu mai, and no pork buns! Another big no-no!

Let's not even take into consideration that if this is take-out food, you will probably want utensils. None was to be found!

OK, now let's get into the food itself. The dimsum was just OK, our expectations completely ruined by the discrepancy in the actual items.
The walnut prawns was not bad. But remember what I said about the location? Take a walk down to Wonderland and you will find much better walnut prawns.
The Hunan tofu was decent, probably the best dish we got. The Yang Chow fried rice was so-so. Again, I've had better, probably Red Jade.

Overall, I think if I rate the food itself, it's probably 3.5 stars. But the service was definitely subpar. Remember, this is San Francisco, competition is going to be stiff at best.
We will probably not get food from here again.
author: S K.

description: I ordered the orange chicken and chicken chow mien, both portions were gigantic and over priced. both tasted terrible. I got sick to my stomach after eating the food. I don't understand how they can charge so much, they should make much smaller portions with much more reasonable prices, and maybe actually go back to cooking class so they don't make their customers sick.
author: Aaron R.

description:
WE LOVE KUNG FOOD WITH ALL OF OUR HEARTS!
We typically get the General Tsao's Tofu, the Veggie Lo Mein, the Veggie Fried Rice, and Veggie Spring Rolls. The food is always fast and hot. Both delivery and in-restaurant service are superb. The staff is very welcoming and will remember you if you come in often. There are both vegetarian and vegan options. Kung Food, if you're reading this, we love you.
Love,
The Snax Fam of the Kappa Alpha Theta chapter at the University of San Francisco
author: Katelynn P.

description: Always knew this place was a dump of Chinese trash food. Got the "chef specialty dish" recommended by the workers, the prawns and walnuts; which is always a winner except here apparently...burnt walnuts, the shrimp was totally over salted which is alarming bc this dish doesn't call for salt and wonderful onion skin shreds left in dish? Orange chicken was soggy really unimpressed with service, prices and flavor. Save your money and time with so many other solid Chinese options in town.
author: Brittany C.

description:
This is the first place I've found in SF where I can get high-quality American Chinese food. My food was prepared in 20 minutes and the staff were courteous when I came to pick it up. I'll be a repeat customer.

Update: I was a repeat customer, after they were closed for a couple months (renovation? vacation?). It wasn't as good the second time so I've reduced them from 5* to 4* because consistency is a key part of excellence!
author: Ben B.

description:
This place was just OK for American Chinese food delivery. There are other places in the city I like more and I don't plan on ordering from here again.

I got the veggie chow mein, pork potstickers, dim sum combination plate (two pork buns, two shrimp dumplings, two sui mai), General Tso's, and crab rangoon.

The veggie chow mein was tasteless, the dim sum was bland, and the crab rangoon was really fishy and the shell was thick and tough.

The General Tso's was the best dish, but still pretty average. I was pleased with the delivery time - it came quicker than estimated. The portions were also generous.
author: Emma B.

description:
It was late and I wanted to pick up some take out before heading home. I ordered through yelp, which made things easy. Food was ready by the time I got there to pick it up.

The noodles were dry and the eggplant dish was salty. It was ok, but definitely have had better.
author: Jessica S.

description: Ordered to be delivered. The wait was about an hour - which we told upfront. No problem with that. The food wasn't even average. Pork pot sticker was most likely chicken. That aside, the pot sticker dough was very thick and more like a dumpling for soup. The Moo Shoo porkwas so-so. Chicken fried rice was also so-so.
author: A.M. E.

description: This place is a victim of its own success. The food used to be consistently decent Chinese takeout but each time I've gone in it's been worse and worse. I go for the westernized classics like Kong pow chicken and beef and broccoli which used to be made with decent meat, seasoned well, and cooked fresh, but lately everything has been chewy and bland. This place would be 100% better if they'd just put in 10% more effort...and include some vegetables with the meat dishes.
author: Someguy W.

description:
Andy spits hot fire, he cooks hot food, and that's that.  Legitimately one of the best around.  Great atmosphere.  Honey walnut prawns are a crowd pleaser.

Ask Andy to get on the microphone if you know what's good for you.
author: Brett H.

description:
Good portions, reasonably priced, and it actually taste good. This is a nice neighborhood spot that is close to my house. If I'm ever in need of something quick to eat, this is definitely on my list of restaurants. 

I've never been here for lunch, but their lunch combos look appetizing and for less than $10 in SF!!!!!
author: Justin Y.

description:
My regular place for a decent , affordable Chinese food. Their portion is probably the biggest in the entire city.
My favorites are dragon beef/ ckn , pan fired noodle ,and house green onion pancake
author: Jamie Y.

description: We got delivery on a Sunday afternoon and the food came quickly, but it was all incredibly bland. We ordered a mild orange chicken and a hot General Tsaos and they tasted pretty much identical. Fried rice and chow mein were not even seasoned at all. Bland and boring, all of it.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
I really wanted to like this place but large portions of only ok food doesn't make up for overv an hour and forty five minute wait on delivery.   

String Bean Beef was tasty. Beans were perfectly cooked and very fresh with a fair amount of beef. It was dry fried, which I like, but the ample garlic was only on half the dish. Odd that it wasn't completely stirred through and completely missing red chilis. 

General Tsao's Chicken could have been very good but not this time. The chicken was prepared well with large boneless chunks battered with the skin on then deep fried till nicely crisp. The sauce was the problem. I asked for it medium hot and,  though vinegary, wasn't spicy at all. Certainly needed something to balance the syrupy sweetness. Was also missing broccoli mentioned  on their website menu.

Combination fried rice was ok but nothing special. 

Lots of reviews here are great so maybe they had a bad night. It happens. We'll give Kung Food another shot some time. Just not for a while.
author: M M.

description:
God damn..... This is what authentic Chinese food is all about.

The whole staff are Asian
author: Looney l.

description: This lunch spot provided a great atmosphere, great portions and friendly wait staff. The food was hot and delicious. Street parking was easy.I fed my 3 person men crew for $40.00.
author: Jeanne E.

description: Love this place! Delivery usually takes under 45 minutes and it is delicious! Crispy Dragon Beef is where it is at. Their chow mein is also really good! Highly recommend and it's very reasonably priced! Been eating  here for about 3 years now, every time the fold is hot, fresh, and made to order. I try to hit up kung food every time I'm in the city.
author: Michael V.

description: Ordered takeout and was pretty underwhelmed considering the great reviews. The general chicken was dry and stringy and chow mein was flavorless. The potstickers was the only bright spot.
author: Josh F.

description: The place is very small, but the food is super delicious. The portions are very good. The staff is very nice, and sometimes, you can hear some rapping words, by the popular young rapper Ch..Yang. he is cool, down to earth. He is a friendly dude. I'm telling you, food is awesome you will eat with gusto. Yo, Yo, Yo, get your food from this place, it is very tasty and delicious, you won't be disappointed.
author: Os G.

description: Cute Name, good food.  A little pricey for what you get but thems the breaks in San Francisco.  The to-go items can get a little soggy as well but just eat them quickly and you will be fine.
author: Jason T.

description: Hey never ate here before. Just wanna stop by to say good job in the rap of china for yang xiaochuan (the owner of this joint). 666 加油. Will stop by when im in SF.
author: Anna Y.

description: Very fast, big portion sizes, and tastes great for a very affordable price. Their delivery time unfortunately takes very long so I just order take-out and that's much faster.
author: Tony C.

description: Not at all authentic in any way but good portions, fair prices, decent service. Good choice if you are a fan of Americanized Chinese food. Personally I am not; so take that advice as you will.
author: Crystal Y.

description:
Ordered takeout and everything was disappointing. Had shrimp fried rice and it badly needed salt and the rice tasted like it had been nuked in a microwave for a while, it was about as good as frozen fried rice that you microwave. I'm also sensitive to salt so the fact that I thought it was bland says a lot. 

The hot and sour soup was better, a bit on the too sour side but was decent. 

Shrimp dumplings were average (like would eat them again) but I was so disappointed by the shrimp fried rice (which I think is a dish that Chinese restaurants should do well) that I had to give the 1 star.
author: S W.

description:
My decision to try this place was based upon the name alone. 

The food is amazing. Fresh ingredients, not too oily. We had the following:

- Hot and Sour soup: delicious, hot but not too hot (for me there's no such thing as "too hot", but I digress). Bonus: my husband told me that the black chewy strands are mushrooms. I never knew this. Years of eating hot and sour soup and who knew? But I love them so maybe I'm not as picky as I thought. Moving on...

- Fried Wonton w/Pork: Perfectly golden, perfectly crunchy. It's hard to find a perfect wonton, and here it is. 

- Mongolian Beef: I'm usually dismayed by the meat in dishes like this. Not this time. The onions (shallots perhaps?) were just right and the beef was generous, lean, and flavorful. The sauce was light and spicy- none of that sticky-sweet, cornstarch-laden stuff. 

Good thing we don't live closer, I'd weigh a million pounds.
author: Robin G.

description:
Who knew?  I've been staying around here from time to time on various projects over the years, never knew this place existed, etc.  Got the desire for Chinese and a google search led me here, only a few blocks away from where I stay...

Went in to order, order was ready in just a few minutes.  Got Kung Pao Chicken, prices are in line.  When I got back to my place and opened the bag, I was surprised by the size of the chicken pieces...huge. Normally I'm accustomed to small cube like pieces in Kung Pao Chicken, this order contained very large pieces.  Quantity was above average. No idea if someone got lazy in the kitchen, but it definitely made it a meal!

Will definitely return and try something else... highly recommend.

Sorry didn't take a pik, was too busy eating!
author: Steve M.

description: Wow this might be the worst treatment I've ever received at a restaurant. I will never come back here again.
author: Josh A.

description: Great food, exactly what you want after some quality adventures in the Park  we had the pork dumplings and General Tsoa chicken, and came away feeling fulfilled, full, and delighted!
author: Cam L.

description: The food is amazing! As a Chinese I think the food is super authentic and well cooked. The ingredients taste very fresh. Really liked the fried rice and the beef. The barbecue chicken is good too. If you have a big party of people, be sure to ask for some signature dish recommendation!
author: Don Y.

description: Restaurant is small but comfortable! Food was great! Large portions to share!! Offered us green tea before and after our meal! Fried rice is good salt & pepper wings were yummy! Chicken noodles were awesome! Sweet & sour pork was excellent! Fried prawn appetizers were delicious! They don't provide beer but said they would charge a dollar if you went next door to buy at market and could bring inside restaurant. They didn't provide lemons either. Bummer for me personally because I love lemon with my water and with my food but everything else was great! Customer service was excellent very friendly for a good price! I will return again to my next trip to San Fran!!
author: Allana G.

description: Somewhat very underrated place. Not the most authentic as it doesn't have that OG Chinese homestyle feeling. But don't get me wrong, the Americanized fusion taste comes together beautifully. Really no bad dishes and their Korean chicken wings was surprisingly delicious (which is not even Chinese food).
author: Hanyu Q.

description: This was my go-to chinese food (delivery or carry-out) in my neighborhood.  This says a lot as I'mp picky abouy chinese food.  Very fast and good!  I especially like the crab rangoon and chicken dishes.
author: Renee F.

description:
Big fan of this spot, right around the corner of my house. An authentic Asian spot. I really liked the Chow Fun, and they have BOMB asian hot sauce. 

The owners are rappers in China, and are a fun bunch!
author: Grace C.

description:
#28/2016

I'm upgrading Kung Food's rating from 4 to 5 stars.

Their entrees are consistently excellent: They're well-prepared, flavorful and unique (Hunan Butter Beef, just get it!)

The meats are grilled, their flavors on point, they'll cook without MSG (just ask) and their customer service, outstanding. 

So, so good!
author: Jennifer O.

description: Cheap lunch special until 3pm with a variety of entree options that come with a side of rice, soup and an egg roll.  Super quick delivery, but pretty small delivery zone.  3 stars only because my beef brócoli had wayyyy to many garlic pieces that made it difficult to finish.  I recommend the chicken wonton soup.
author: Andrea T.

description: Fresh, affordable, friendly, and good!!! Thank you Kung Food for all the years of good food. You have nailed it with your delivery time and table service!!!
author: Thomas B.

description:
My absolute FAVORITE in the city! I always come here when I'm in Divisadero. The staff is super friendly and the food is AMAZING. Not to mention they're quick with getting it out. The beef chow mein is a personal fave. Usually, Chinese restaurants can be a little intimidating, especially when you're ordering, but the staff here never makes you feel awkward. 

Environment: 10
Staff: 10
Food: 11
author: Jaclyn L.

description: The food is always delicious and fresh and the owner always greets me with a wonderful smile! Gotta love Andy for his smile and his innovative hip-hop style, he and Jamie are the best and they can win any food contest!!!
author: pazelee d.

description: Never have the food there but the owner Andy is killing it at rapping. 10/10 would have Kung food when I go to SF
author: Shan H.

description:
Sometimes, when the going gets tough, the tough gets American Chinese food delivered to their home as comfort food.

Kung Food has been a reliable choice for me since I moved out here to SF. I had the General Tso's chicken and walnut prawns and they were as good as people say (Imo).

Just a note, however. Make sure to order steamed rice as the entrees don't come with them. They are $1.50 each.
author: Allyson J.

description:
Mango shrimp Salad was thrown right away
Sweet aChicken smelled bad and greasy
Food wasnt savoury at all
author: Christina D.

description: I ordered this for the second time for delivery. The food was okay the first time and the second, the food was terrible... but the worst part was-- I FOUND A BUG IN MY FOOD!!!! It looked like a mini cockroach!!!
author: Jessie A.

description:
Not the worst i'v had, not quite to the middle though. 
Kung pao was watery, not a lot of flavor. 
I had a takeout order. Got back and they forgot to include rice. How do you forget the rice?
Many better restaurants on that stretch of road, pass this one by.
author: Mark M.

description: Ordered online and asked for my food to not be cooked until a certain time and my food was probably made right after I placed the order. By the time I got my food it seemed all stale and as if it had been sitting for quite some time. I would recommend not placing an order until you are ready to pick it up.  Sesame chicken seemed stale and as if there were multiple types of chicken and a bit tough to eat.
author: Chavariana R.

description: Awesome service and pretty good crab Rangoon's . The portions are pretty good size for the price . My favorite cheap and easy Chinese place in town
author: Noah M.

description:
This is my first and only counterexample to my rule of "if yelp rates it 4 stars or better, it's good". I got the General Tso's, which had the "flavor" knob stuck at 1 (but only because they couldn't turn it any lower) - unless you count the flavor of over-fried, over-breaded meat (which was really chewey). Ok, let's turn it over to the Shredded Pork with Garlic Sauce - generally one of my most favorite menu items. Nope; here too, the flavor was very off - kinda bitter, no garlic to speak off, and about 80% some kind of shredded vegetable. At least with that one they did actually make it a little spicy...not as spicy as I requested, but at least something.

I might try the orange chicken one day, but otherwise will not be back.
author: Chris S.

description:
Great quality meat! That's the biggest thing with casual chinese places. It doesnt feel like I'm eating old gristle. The meat is good cuts. Bravo on that. 

Overall taste is excellent. Exactly what I want when grabbing Chinese of this type. Works great as takeout or dine in.

I've tried quite a few different items at this point. I've enjoyed them all. Definitely one of the better chinese restaurants of this type in the city.
author: Ryan B.

description: Some of the best Chinese food in the city. Your options are endless from beef, poultry, seafood and all kinds of veggies! As an herbivore myself, there was plenty on the menu to choose from. The food is ready on time and the portions are whopping!!! Best value overall!
author: Lucia R.

description:
My first time here was amazing. Glad i finally got the chance to come back.

I got the orange chicken lunch special, which comes with a cup of hot and sour soup. I'm not usually a fan of hot and sour but theirs is pretty darn good. 

The orange chicken was perfectly crispy and not over cooked. Fried rice was super rich.

Service was friendly and quick. 

If you are ever in the mood for awesome Chinese food,  then this is the place to go!
author: Marco F.

description:
I've been here a few times for dinner, and am definitely a fan! Happened to take a look at the lunch specials, and I was immediately interested. :p

Got the mango chicken, which is so much food, I will definitely be eating it for two meals! The complimentary soup and egg roll are also a nice touch, and of appropriate sizes, IMO.

So. Much. Food. And. So. Yum!
author: Shendi X.

description: All their prices just shot up by $1-2 recently. Almost $12 now for something with chicken, which used to be around $9 not too long ago. Considering the food here is generally mediocre and inconsistent, probably won't be ordering from here again unless I'm really craving their chicken wings.
author: Brendan R.

description:
Not sure where I went wrong. Ordered via Yelp Eat24 for delivery. Food came in a timely manner - no issues there, but the food tasted off.

We ordered 2 things:
-Westlake beef soup
Soup was weirdly sweet - never had a sweet westlake beef soup before. tastes like they added a ton of sugar instead of salt? Tried to douse the whole thing with soy sauce to compensate. No luck there. Trashed the whole thing.

-General Tsao's Chicken
Delivered cold and was no longer crunchy (although expected of delivery, I guess). Generally unappetizing - trashed this as well after a couple of bites. 

Needless to say, I will be trying a different chinese take out place next time.
author: Patricia K.

description: Delicious! Definitely not he most authentic Chinese restaurant but the food is really good. 10/10 recommend
author: Hallie M.

description:
The food was amazing!!!!
The combo fried rice had so much flavor and a monstrous portions to satisfy any appetite. 
I also ordered the Kung pao chicken... I could not believe the taste.  This is by far the best takeout I've EVER had. 
Plus the delivery was Super Duper Fast!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Super fast delivery good prices & big portions. Can't go wrong with the poultry and veggies or chicken corn soup. 
I recently had them again take out. The chow mein was delish as was the rest of the food!
author: Brenda M.

description:
This place is my jam! I've been coming here for the past couple years now since pretty much when it opened as I live down the street.

My go-tos:

(1) Chicken Broccoli - gotta get them veggies!
(2) Mongolian Beef - best I've had thus far in the city!
(3) Combo Chow Mein - them noodles are crack!
(4) House Special Pan Fried Noodle - duh.

Absolutely delicious and very generous portions for the price. Whenever I'm craving some good ol' fashion Chinese take out, you know I'm getting my Kung Food on.
author: Justin H.

description: The food is very good. That said, the second time I ordered delivery, the fried rice came in smaller container and was half the amount I got the first time. If that happens again, I'll have to move on.
author: B T.

description: Incredibly fast service, very yummy food, and a clean & comfortable little place. I will definitely be coming back whenever I get the craving for Chinese food.
author: Ruby H.

description: Great service and their meatless dishes are superb! We tried the Kung Pao "shrimp" and sesame "chicken", texture and taste was the best meatless I've ever had. The place can get busy and not much room for seating so plan ahead.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Love Kung Food! The most delicious friendly and accommodating Chinese restaurant in the city that I've found so far. They are extremely flexible with what they can do gluten-free and carry gluten-free soy sauce. The staff is goofy and affable.

I usually get the chow fun. Fun in taste, portion, and value. People highly recommend their wings but they're not GF. Generally do take out but the small restaurant has a nice ambience and attentive staff.

Highly recommended for those with gluten allergies or large stomachs. Thanks Kung Food!
author: Gabe S.

description: Andy and Lei Lei run a personalized family business. I order from them at least a few times a month. They know my name, what I want - and even make sure I get my pot-sticker sauce with my BBQ Pork Steamed Buns (YUMM - you gotta try it!). I am partial to the Orange Chicken which I like hot but specify your spice level for sure. the food is great and tastes even better when you heat it up the next day as the portions are too generous for one sitting. I highly recommend you not only eat here, but make friends with these guys - they treat me like family when I call.
author: Kevin M.

description: poor service and poor food, when it takes nearly 2 hours to deliver crappy food you get 1 star review
author: Paul K.

description:
i'm not sure how this place has 4 stars. ordered the combo fried rice, chicken corn soup and chicken in black bean sauce. 

everything was bland, lacking in any flavor. i usually don't add soy sauce to my chinese food but had to pour it all over the rice and in the soup. the chicken corn soup looked like they just added ground chicken to the egg flower soup. the chicken in black bean sauce was dry and the sauce was watery. 

this place wasn't quick or cheap either. i can't believe i paid $35 and waited over and hour for this.  

this was the only delivery chinese near my friend's place, but i'd say save yourself some grief and order takeout from somewhere else and go pick it up.
author: Jimmy C.

description: While the pot stickers were served with a great dipping sauce and the chow main was average and the pork buns were hot, that's it. Doesn't say much for the rest of the food we ordered does it? Lack luster in flavor eye appeal and texture this was a meal but in this city I don't know how you can stay open serving this meager fare for these prices. USED to be quite delicious actually.
author: Gregory F.

description: Uncomplicated good food- HunN Fish: Fish and vegetables very fresh and perfectly cooked, not very spicy.
author: Holly H.

description:
Disappointing. I ordered delivery and it took over an hour to get here. It would've been fine were the food delicious / good, but it missed the bar. I ordered Chinese broccoli + beef; sweet & sour chicken; and crab rangoons.

Both tasted healthy (not in a good way).
The sweet & sour chicken was made with TOUGH white meat, and the sauce oddly tasted like cherry cough medicine. ugh, probably the worst I've ever had from any Chinese restaurant.
The broccoli & beef tasted like something I could make (but a worse version of it). Everything was so bland and tasted like simple salt + soy sauce + pepper seasoning I can make at 1/5th the price (if not less).
The best thing we got was the crab rangoons - so would recommend this. 

Not sure where the dazzling reviews are coming from, but I was left very dissatisfied and barely finished half of what we ordered :\
author: Claudia C.

description: I've only gotten take out here. Fast, convenient, friendly and pretty good food with good portions. Wish they opened before 5pm for dinner.
author: alvin l.

description: Tried this place on a whim last night and I'm so glad I did. The food was amazing. I fed a family of 4 with three items and still have leftovers. This will definitely be my go to place for Chinese cuisine!
author: Cola W.

description:
If you are looking for so called 'authentic Chinese style Chinese dishes', don't go here. This place is more American style Chinese restaurant, which I often craving for after the hard work.

The space is relatively small, but it's worth to wait if you are very hungry because their portion is really huge! If you are two hungry couple, order one entree, one dimsum, and two bowls of rice would be more than enough.

My favorite dish there is Mango chicken.
author: Shihomi K.

description: Solid food and close to my apartment! What's not to love? Lunch specials are pretty generous too.
author: Jenelle L.

description: Meh.  Large portions but not particularly great food.  The food came out very very fast, like it was microwaved or already waiting. The pork fried rice was bland.   The lemon chicken was over cooked. Perhaps the time I spent in China eating fresh Chinese ruined my palate for average Chinese.
author: Peppermint N.

description: Best Chinese delivery in the area. got mu shu pork, general tso's chicken and crab rangoon - all were good, delivered hot and in 45 mins.
author: Erica W.

description: Food is decent for Chinese takeout. Delivery said it would take about 50 minutes and the food came within 60 minutes so not too shabby. The green onion pancakes were lacking on the green onion so the flavor profile was not as intense as I expected. The food overall was ok, not the best, but not the worst. My only major problem with this place was that about halfway through the meal, I noticed that parts of the lids of the takeout containers were broken and I could not find the fragments that broke off.
author: Julie L.

description: Decent large portion for dinner and lunch. Not all dishes are great but the owner is super nice and attentive.
author: Pete P.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and tried this place three times. The food is absolutely terrible!
Last time I ordered a chicken plate which was absolutely bitter and had stomach issues.
Please don't order from this restaurant.
author: Diya G.

description: It was really not good. The food was clearly microwaved as the chicken was so overcooked that no fork could pierce it. The flavor might have been ok on a few items, but since it was inedible, we threw it all out.
author: Tasha R.

description: I got the salt and pepper pork chop and the beef chow fun. I found both to be insanely greasy. The pork chop was very fatty and really cooked so it was too well done and was unpleasant to eat. It also had little flavor. The chow fun was also super greasy and flavorless.
author: Ryan L.

description: The Chinese food here is on fleek! I had the General Tsao lunch special and it was delicious. I genuinely wanted to eat all of it but I was just so full! I will definitely be ordering lunch from here again :)
author: Natalie M.

description: Great taste, and very big portion. The owner is super nice, and family friendly. Must try the chef specials and Korean Chicken wings.
author: Enhui L.

description:
I ordered food for delivery at 8 (on eat24), was charged and told the order was confirmed for delivery. It's been 2 hours and no food, no call and the restaurant is now closed. They aren't answering the phone. 

If I get a call AND my money reimbursed I will update my rating.

*UPDATE* I called in and was told that at the time I ordered it was very busy. I'm still not sure why a phone call was never made but the owner was apologetic and offered a free entrée if I ordered again. He advised to call them directly next time.   

I'm just waiting for my Eat24 refund now.
author: Drew I.

description: Went with a friend before a show at the Independent.  Had sizzling rice soup and tofu/string beans. Both were excellent, and very fresh. Friend had the scallion pancakes and said they weren't amazing, but I'm posting for what I had. Service was good.
author: Pamela D.

description: Solid 4 stars for good American Chinese food that delivers to me fast!  I like the salted fish fried rice, Mushroooms with bok choy especially.  I've eaten in once, the Korean style wings are best eaten in as opposed to delivery.  Never too salty, greasy, it's satisfying comfort food to me.
author: Mirba E.

description: I would highly recommend this place just for the service.  The atmosphere is quaint and friendly.  The menu has a pretty large menu and most of the dishes are typical of a normal Chinese restaurant.  However the portions are pretty big and good is tasty.  Service is excellent!!  Asked for some ice and the waitress advised us hey didn't have any.  To my surprise she went across the street to get us some ice.  Now that is something I don't see everyday.
author: Leon L.

description: Pretty mediocre American Chinese food. Decided to give them a try because they got some good reviews but both me and my dining partner were unimpressed. It was pretty bland, all in all. Soup was watery, main dishes were bland.
author: C S.

description: Everything is delicious. It can be a long wait for delivery, but if you get there early for dinner, you will have the restaurant all to yourself. You are doing yourself a disservice if you skip a chance to eat at Kung Food. Staff is also incredibly friendly.
author: Jess S.

description: Pros- they don't use msg or go crazy with the salt.  Cons- food is generally lacking in any flavor and sort of bland.  The hot and sour soup was decent. The sweet and sour and chicken has good quality white chicken breast meat but lacking any real flavor..
author: Samir K.

description: Really good meal. Will post pictures next visit. Was too hungry and too excited  to take pictures... it was that good.
author: Barbara M.

description: Mediocre food but the at home delivery was fast on a Saturday evening! The Chowfun was blotchy with chunks of thick noodles stuck to each other, yet it tasted B+. The black pepper Tofu had none of black pepper and was rather bland although my wife seemed to liked it. The pot stickers were yuck!!!! Threw them away--wasted money. The cucumber salad was highly avoidable--rather bland and boring. I've had such good cucumber sales elsewhere, this one was a disappointment.
author: Sam M.

description:
A fantastic neighborhood Chinese food joint. I have zero complaints for this place. 

Let me break it down for easy reading:
- you can order online
- food is always ready lightning fast
- vegetarian friendly
- every veggie dish I have ordered has been full of fresh and delicious vegetables. Broccoli, carrots, snow peas, water chestnuts, green beans, cabbage... all crispy and yummy.
- lots of variety on the menu
- inexpensive, but you aren't getting cheap greasy food. Good stuff here.

The restaurant itself is small, and I have always done takeout so I cannot speak to a dine-in experience. But it looks nice inside, and smells amazing.

My personal favorite dish is the crispy fried noodle with veggies. Two thumbs up.
author: Jackie W.

description: Soooo good recommend m Kung pao and beef and broccoli. Great for deliveries or to go. Scenery inside is nice. It is quite small so it's best for takeout
author: Mutale M.

description: We order from here all the time and have never been disappointed. Our meal is always hot and tasty. The pineapple fried rice, in particular, is a favorite in our household.
author: L. W.

description: Our local Chinese food spot. We usually order for pick up and it is always ready on time. Food is good...Our favorite is the mango shrimp and the cashew chicken.
author: Harris C.

description: This was a wonderful meal with great service! We had the orange chicken, curry beef & fried tofu, pork fried rice, and veggie chow fun. It was all DELICIOUS. We had a water pitcher that was always refilled in a timely manner (which is so nice since some restaurants let you go thirsty) and a tea pot that was refilled with hot water when needed. Overall this was so yummy and I'll definitely come back
author: Ryan Q.

description: What a fun place to go eat in the city. Super yummy food and the service was great! Mongolian chicken was excellent
author: Patti B.

description:
I've died and gone to heaven. This place is  just nuts. Cozy family owned spot with hospitality to match! 

Oh and the food is outrageous fresh and good. 

pound for pound the best value in SF. 

Hunan butter beef
Black bean asparagus and bok Choi
Pineapple shrimp fried rice 
Pork chow mein (free with 2 entrees)
Shanghai dumplings
$40

And enough to feed 2-3 hungry hippos for dinner and then lunch the next day. 

Bourdain needs to come here!

Thank you Andy and Uncle!!!!
author: Armen M.

description: Great place for Asian options. They're quick and responsive and the food isn't too bad either. Very close to the actual Asian food I had back home.
author: Samantha C.

description:
The food is excellent, but delivery is consistently slow.

I've ordered delivery from them a number of times and everything is solid. The food is tasty, good portions, a little bit cheaper than my old standby... all great reasons that have kept me coming back. But the delivery times... wow. They're not quite a mile from my home, maybe a five-minute drive, yet every time they manage to push the already lengthy 45-60 minute estimated delivery window out not just to the maximum, but usually well past it. Waits of an hour and twenty minutes aren't uncommon or ever even acknowledged as a failure on their part. When my previous favorite place used to deliver from slightly further away in about 20-30 minutes, it's simply not acceptable.

Four stars on the food. Two stars on the delivery.
author: Mark S.

description:
This is my favorite place to get food. Nice people are working there and the food is awesome. 
Try the walnut prawns
author: Johan H.

description: Fast, friendly, large portions, really great orange chicken. That's all I had so I can't comment on the rest of the menu. Will be back!
author: Griffen H.

description: I ordered the Korean fried chicken lunch meal and it came with white rice, hot & sour soup and egg roll. The fried chicken was savory and delicious, the chicken skin batter wasn't overly saucy, chewy or dry. It had a good crunch while maintaining shape. I ordered very spicy but wasn't impressed of the spice level. I have a pretty High tolerance for spicy (chilli) food. The portion was perfect. Not too little portion but just right. Delivery was quick! Will order again
author: Jennifer N.

description: Best Chinese I've had in a long time! Portions are very generous and price reasonable. Staff are always very friendly and accommodating . One of my go to places to eat in the city.
author: Abby W.

description: Absolutely disgusting! The food has NO taste whatsoever. Don't bother ordering the hot & sour soup because it straight up tastes like vinegar. Even the simplest soup (eggflower soup) tastes like pure water. The sesame chicken isn't even chicken. NEVER coming back here again!!
author: Sabrina D.

description:
I've been living in the area for many years and there are no good chinese places, until now. I tried this place for the first time the other week and it won't be my last time. 

Loved the combination fried rice and fish dishes.

So happy you are here, Kung Food.
Good job on the name of the place too. I like it!
author: Cicely T.

description:
Ordered some lunch specials for me and my friends to be delivered. The piping hot food came in 35 minutes after we put in our order and also came with bonus egg rolls and soup. Heck yeah!

My friends got the garlic eggplant and honey walnut shrimp which was good. It's cool that they let you choose between white rice, brown rice, egg fried rice or chow mein.

My only complaint is that the lemon chicken was super dry and rough because they used white meat and could have fried it too long... but it was still edible. Just wish they used dark meat instead. I should have gotten the vegetarian chicken! 

Their menu is pretty extensive and affordable so next time I want to get the crab rangoons!
author: Bonnie S.

description: Hole in the wall location but clean food... Andy the owner and his sister are really great so worth for both dine in or take out
author: Purvi S.

description: Huge portions, awesome quality, my go-to Chinese take out spot.  Owner is chill and always dishing some good recommendations.  General Tso, hot n sour soup is always on point.  Lunch special is a good deal to get, just know they are closed Mondays.
author: Byung K.

description:
My cousin took me and my husband to Kung Food. I love Hunan cuisine and this place, I thought, is just the right place.  I was not disappointed. For appetizers, we ordered Fried Calamari and Shanghai Style Dumplings. Sweet and Sour Soup and Fried Egg Rolls were complementary. I had Hunan Chicken, my husband had Mongolian Beef & my cousin had custom made non spicy stir fried all beef with egg noodles.

The menu has salad selections and various healthy menu options. The sauces were very good, not too spicy. The Hunan Chicken had generous pieces of chicken breast. The food is neither salty nor was it greasy and, it is reasonably priced!

We will definitely come back to try the Korean Spicy Wings, Green Onion Pancakes & Green Beans from the vegetarian selections.
author: Cynthia F.

description: We stopped in during lunch and had a great experience!  We were immediately seated and provided with menus.  Andres, our friendly host (and owner of this fine establishment) recommended we try the orange chicken or Dragon Chicken.  We tried the latter, which was delicious!  The chicken was crisp and lightly breaded. The dish was stir fried with red onion and dry chili peppers.   The sauce was sweet and mildly spicy with a hint of ginger and bell pepper.  Portion size was plentiful.  It was accompanied by hot and sour soup and an egg roll.  I will definitely stop in the next time I'm in the city!
author: Melanie R.

description:
I found this little gem right off Divisadero during work one day... and 3 months after my first visit, I'm still craving their General Tsao Chicken. Their lunch specials are great and come with a yummy homemade sweet and sour soup, egg roll, rice + main dish of your choice. This time around I tried the Dragon Beef w/ chow mein ($1 extra). What I love about this place are the little things:
- It's really refreshing to have both the soup and egg roll served HOT, and not luke warm and have your main dish come out just as hot.
- The cuts of meat they use - whether it's tender pieces of beef in the Dragon Beef or white meat chicken in the General Tsao.
- Their service and passion for the food served. 

Dragon Beef lunch special  was really good. Nice and crispy amongst all pieces. Sauce was well balanced between spicy, tangy and sweet. The dish came our nice and saucy so the chow mein could soak up all that goodness. I also love the use of mixed veg in the chow mein - not just bean sprouts or onions like most Chinese lunch spots. 

If you're looking for a solid Chinese-American spot, look no further. Each dish is prepared with quality ingredients and paired with tasty sauces all at a great price. Keep it up Kung Food, you're doin' it right!
author: Ben W.

description: I've been trying the different appetizers and noodles. The fried rice plates are delicious and I love the House Special Pan Noodle. Haven't had any issues with this place getting the orders correct (delivery and pickup) and the staff is always nice.
author: Hoan L.

description: I had ordered for delivery the pork fried rice, hot and sour soup and steamed vegetable dumplings.   The delivery was fast and the food was hot.  However, the dumplings were not tasty, they were doughy and bland.  The soup had a bit too much sour and not enough hot while the fried rice was dry and missing a lacking  in egg, vegetables and pork.  Skimpy comes to mind.   I love Chinese food and would try Kung again, but if any other alternative is available I would choose that first.
author: Elias W.

description:
Unfortunately the pan fried noodles I ordered were moldy. Nope nope nope. That certainly left a bad taste in my mouth (literally and figuratively).

Service was quick when I ordered for take out, but sadly this also means I don't get a second chance at a decent meal if my order is sub par.
author: Iris H.

description:
Kung Food is one of my favorite establishments in San Francisco that I never hesitate to recommend to friends. If you're looking for a great atmosphere and surprisingly great food for the pice, this is your joint. The menu is pretty diverse, with a great selection of soups, meat dishes and really good veggies. After trying a large portion of the menu, some of my favorites are the won-ton soup, basil chicken, bok choy beef and dragon chicken/beef. The won-ton combination soup is some of the best I've had. The broth is thick and the mix of the fresh vegetables marinating into it gives it a great flavor. I would recommend it with shrimp. The prawns here are thick and delicious. My second suggestion is to try the basil chicken. It's nicely seasoned, light and the vegetables are fantastic. Even as a meat lover I find myself cleaning the greens off the plate first here. Even for people that don't like a lot of heat, the spicy plates are not to be avoided. They have a great balance of spice and flavor that won't leave you sweating.

The customer service here is incredible and I always try to dine in. Andy is the man and will take complete care of you. He's always making sure that his patrons are satisfied and is as personable and friendly as they come. I've also never seen food fly out of the kitchen so fast. Oh, and you'll need a take home box. These portions are big. Kung Food has all the vibes of a small town establishment in a big city like San Francisco. If you're on the Divisadero stretch don't pass this place up or you'll be disappointed. 

Keep doing your thing, Andy!
author: Matthew Z.

description: Amazing food. Awesome service. The girls there were very helpful when we were deciding what we wanted to eat and even made some suggestions. I was only visiting SF, but if I lived there. I would definitely make that a regular spot!
author: Andrea R.

description: FYI guys, the free fried rice or chow mein with 2 entrees is no longer free. It's $2 as of June 1, 2016.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I was looking for some good Chinese food that was walking distance from my place and luckily i found this great establishment. I've been to the burrito joint next door to them and never realized they were around the corner. What a great FIND!! Their General Tsao's chicken is very good and very affordable. They open at 11 and have lunch specials. Pay 6-8 bucks and you get a WHOLE LOTTA FOOD! i suggest dining in because you get more food on the plate than getting it packaged in box. The workers there are really kind and welcoming. The restaurant is kinda small but cozy and decorated nicely. 

Tips: closed on Mondays. Lunch specials start at 11 ends at 3. On their paper menu, there's a coupon for a free side of chow mein or fried rice when you order to entrees. If you dont have the coupon, mention it and they will hook you up. I got hooked up. THANKS KUNG FOOD!
author: Jordan C.

description:
A few updates:

Their pork buns are 4/5. A bit too sweet but really good
Kung pao chicken was ok (2.5/5)
The staff are very nice and friendly! 

Seems like it can go either way really (see my initial review on the mapo tofu)
author: Nicholas N.

description:
Their meatless chicken dishes were so good ! We loved their sweet and sour meatless chicken and the kung pow meatless chicken. I saw that some have complained about the texture of the meatless chicken, I don't what they are complaining about. Three of us were vegetarians and we loved the texture and flavor. We also had the vegetarian pot stickers, which were delicious and a good size. I highly recommend for vegetarians. 

Also note: the sizes are large, we had plenty of leftovers
author: Adrian N.

description: My favorite Chinese restaurant in San Francisco.  Easy to order delivery online and the best general chicken.  We also like the string bean chicken and fried rice.  Very long menu with lots of choices and friendly staff
author: Jamyang C.

description: I came here with a friend after a long day of walking around Mission & Haight for a quiet, sit-down meal that wouldn't break the bank. The man working the phone/register and who waited on us and served us (I presume he was the owner) was incredibly friendly and warm from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. He was attentive and perceptive with us and the other patrons in the restaurant and people coming in to pick up take-out as well. We ordered orange chicken and Mongolian beef, both indicated as spicy but I didn't find the orange chicken spicy compared with the Mongolian beef (contained jalapeños) but you can always add chili sauce.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Kung Food is my go to Chinese spot in the city. 

The General Tso's chicken is amazing. The chicken is crispy yet tender and the sauce is full of flavor. I always order mine spicy, just to get that extra element of heat. The portions are also very large and the price is amazing. 

The service is fantastic, the food always comes out very quickly. The owner, Andy,  is such a nice guy. He's always smiling, cracking jokes, free styling, and playing good music. He truly cares about each and every customer that walks through the door. He wants to make sure you're having the best experience possible 

If you like Chinese food, I strongly recommend checking this place out. You'll leave with a full stomach and a smile.
author: Harsan S.

description: One of my favorite Chinese places in SF. Can't beat the prices for their lunch specials. Some of their meals are pretty mediocre, though, so try another dish if you didn't enjoy your first experience! Recommend the hunan dragon beef and the walnut prawn.
author: Matthew R.

description:
So I've only ever had them when I'm horribly hung over.... but they've saved me every time. Truth. 

Delivery is super fast (partially because they're like 5 blocks from me), food is super fresh, HUGE portions, great dumpling soup and KFC! 

I always order through Eat24 app but if you want to actually talk to a human, you can call in and if you order 2 or more orders you get a free chow mein or fried rice.
author: Mandi W.

description:
The food was greasy and bland. Not enough spice. I ordered thru Yelp's eat24 app and the food I ordered was not the order the restaurant received. So my first order was for the wrong food. I placed the order on the phone after that. I guess I got to see/sample even more dishes due to this error and none of them really blew me away.

Vegetarian items I tried:
veggie spring rolls - nothing special, as you'd expect
lemon chicken (meatless) - no vegetables, no spice, really weirdly chewy (and I have eaten a lot of meatless things in my life, this was pretty bad)
veggie fried rice - had a good amount of vegetables but didn't have any flavor

My boyfriend got the peking duck and he ate it all.
author: Winona N.

description: Owner is cool as hell and plays biggie smalls and too $hort throwbacks during lunch time..enough said. General tsao chicken is what I get every time..
author: James V.

description:
If you're looking for a good, cheap Chinese place on Diviz', look no further: Kung Food is your place.

The menu is standard, and includes vegetarian options. The ingredients seem fresh. The portions are huge. The flavors are a bit better than expected, but some of the dishes were just a little oily (especially eggplant and fried tofu dishes, which is usually the case anywhere but the finest Chinese restaurants I've been to).

So far, we've sampled the faux-chicken with eggplant, general tsao faux chicken, chicken and veggies, dragon beef (meat candy - so good), chicken lettuce cups, dry fried string beans and eggrolls.  Nothing was bad, and some of it was really good.  

Food was ready for pickup in essence than 20 minutes, and delivery is available (but untested . . . Maybe next time I need a lazy TV day I'll try it out.)
author: Norman H.

description:
Found this place on Eat24 and wasn't expecting much. So I was pleasantly surprised this good it was! I feel like it's hard to find good Chinese.

I ordered the chicken Kung pao and the chinese broccoli with oyster sauce. It wasn't covered in a syrupy sauce. Chinese food places can have a tendency to just be totally sweet and sauced up, and you loose the flavor of the main ingredients.

The veggies were delicious, amazing onions, I'd definitely order from them again. Oh! And my delivery came Hot!
author: Mary H.

description:
Kung Food?  More like Kung-Phooey!

They've been surprisingly awesome for some meals but other times they can also be very salty and/or bland.  

During these unlucky dinner sessions, I can't taste the difference between black bean sauce, garlic sauce, and any other sauces.  When it's cooked properly you CAN taste the difference and it's great.  

I always preferred that they chop their vegetables into smaller pieces.  You got these bell peppers and onions that take up your whole mouth.

Is there a pseudo cook switching off with a master chef?  Perhaps a Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde thing going on?

They're nice people so I want to give them some of my business, but coming here is a gamble.  Do you feel lucky?

If you want another recommendation, try the delivery from Wok Shop Cafe.  They're good most of the time.

J
author: John M.

description: My go to Chinese food spot. They have great service only matched by their great food! Check check them out.
author: Andrew M.

description:
The food here is great. I enjoyed eating here the first time I visited and would have said this is a 4- or 5-star establishment after that experience. And I would still consider eating here.
