But their delivery service is *horrible.* I placed an order yesterday via eat24 and was told to expect the order within 90 minutes. At minute 95, I called to ask about the food status and the woman who answered the phone was unapologetic and curt, but told me it would be in the next order to go out. After another half hour -- by which point we're talking more than 2 hours after I placed the order -- I contacted eat24, and they reached out to the restaurant and were told the same thing, that it would be in the next order out. Another 15 minutes went by with no delivery. After about 2.5 hours, I was both late to an event and still had not received my order, so I canceled it. 

If you cannot get a delivery order out the door in 2.5 hours, you're doing something very wrong. Hire more drivers, or reduce the size of the area in which you deliver.
author: Stuart S.

description:
I'm Chinese and I love food so I feel like my four star rating is well considered. 

This place is a solid Chinese take out place. It's not gourmet and doesn't do anything trendy or innovative (like Mission Chinese). BUT it's great for an everyday very affordable take out place. The portions are HUGE and cheap, the dishes with veggies have lots of veggies (i.e. Tofu with green beans), and everything tastes pretty well seasoned and good. There are no gloopy mystery sauces in anything. They don't put too much sugar or hoisin sauce in their sauces like some places. It feels good to me that their food doesn't taste like it will suddenly give me diabetes (although some on Yelp might complain about stuff being bland). They are also very fast (about 15 minutes for your order to be ready).

Oh and the cherry on top is that the people there are really friendly! A pleasure to interact with!
author: Erin C.

description: Found this place on yelp yesterday. My place to go now for Chinese food! The food was delicious. The service was also excellent! I even met the owner, they were really nice people.
author: Miguel M.

description:
Ordered take-out from here after hearing the witty name from a fellow Uber passenger :)

We ordered:
Honey Walnut Shrimp -- As good as it gets. Been craving this for so long and this really hit the spot
Chow Fun -- The noodles had that really charred taste that Chinese food is known for. Super flavorful with lots of veggies and meat!
Mapo Tofu -- Super spicy and really flavorful. A little intense for me and I love spicy food

Pricing was good and portions were out of control. 3 dishes + rice was definitely a little aggressive...

The epitome of Chinese take-out!
author: Jingxi Z.

description: My go to delivery spot when I am craving Chinese food. I get the Mongolian beef and green onion pancakes which are both delicious. Delivery is always quick and the food is hot. If you want soup I highly recommend the won ton soup.
author: Darius A.

description:
The most passionate host ever.

In addition to generous portions, the host was super welcoming, tentative, and enthusiastic. Totally made the experience. 

10/10 would come again.
author: Becky M.

description: Great chinese fast food take-out.  The General Tso's chicken, is actual real chicken and not over coated with breading like so many places.  I would definitely eat here again.  Also great catchy name!
author: Jack T.

description:
My favorite little spot to order takeout from when I need it. I've only gotten delivery a few times, but it is always fast, and the food comes warm and is not greasy or too salty at all. From reading over reviews, it sounds like a good experience to dine in as well. 

-Chicken Broccoli
-Chicken with Mixed Vegetables
-Yang Chow Fried Rice
-Crab Rangoon
-Bok Choy

All super good and now my go-to to order from in my new apartment.
author: Louise Z.

description: Canned peas and carrots is a non-starter in any dish. In Chinese food it is an abomination. The black mushrooms were reconstituted. They were one one part water logged goo and one unchewable wood pulp. Drive on over to Clement Street where a number of superior alternatives await.
author: Louis G.

description: The food was excellent! In the bay for the day and had to get Chinese before leaving and found this restaurant on yelp! Everything is ala cart in large quantities so it's prefect to share. We ordered the combination dim sum: pork bun, sumai, and shrimp dumpling! So good they were moist flavorful dumplings. Hot and sour soup was delish with tofu and mushroom and other vegetables very substancial. The taste was perfect not too sour and not too spicy. Good pepper flavor. We ordered several dishes and shared amongst ourselves.  Mongolian beef was fresh and spicy. orange chicken was crispy and sauce was perfect not tangy with a hint of spice.  Shrimp Fried rice was so good with adequate amounts of shrimp. Walnut shrimp was perfect crunchy with sweet mayo based sauce and honey walnuts. Best part of all we had left over to take home and they have the traditional Chinese takeout boxes!!! Lastly,  the service was amazing! our server was nice and accommodating with two toddlers. Restaurant is clean and with nice decor. Food was out quickly as well! Definitely will be coming back anytime I'm in the city. I recommend it to anyone living near or traveling from a far. They even deliver!
author: Elizabeth O.

description: What a great find. A well run family business, the dishes we ordered were delicious, nice sized orders. The owner was personable and you could tell treated each guest respectfully.
author: Kari A.

description: Best chinese food I've had in a long time! Sesame chicken, Kung pao chicken, brocoli beef, and fried rice were all delicious. Order it on Eat24 and it was ready right on time ~20-25 minutes.
author: Kelly G.

description: Amazing Chinese food. The general Tso's chicken is divine and their chow mein noodles are delicious!
author: Carly C.

description: Tasty food at bargain prices and friendly service. A good neighborhood spot for a meal.
author: Inago R.

description: Hair found in food! Completely unacceptable! Beware of the cleanliness of this establishment!
author: S B.

description:
Growing up in San Gabriel Valley in LA, Chinese food is both authentic and inexpensive.  San Francisco, while having great Thai and Vietnamese options, lacks good Chinese.  

Luckily for those living in NOPA, Kung Food has opened up and become a go-to spot for pick-up.  Our favorites: Twice Cooked Pork, Mu Shu pork, Ma Po Tofu, Dry String Beans.  

Best things about Kung Food?
1. Owner Andy is great.  Coming in and chatting with him when I pick up food always puts me in a good mood
2. Buy two take-out entrees and get the best chow mein noodles for free.  It's like getting 30% off your meal and it's sooo good

Hungover?  Kung food will be your best friend
author: Angela C.

description:
Best Chinese chicken dishes I've had, EVER. 

Consistent quality, my only qualm is sometimes ordering to go can be a hassle because they forget you are on gold (has happened several times).
author: Bill J.

description:
Finally found a place that has pretty good Chinese Food.  Recently came to Kung Food and ordered the Sesame Chicken.  It was divine!  Just the right amount of sweetness, and the perfect amount of crunch.  The pork fried rice was a real treat too.  

Service was quick and the restaurant was nice and clean.  The staff was nice and friendly.  I would say that I will happily come back.   Looking forward to trying more delicious food.
author: Ronald B.

description:
So far we've loved and demolished the Hunan Butter Beef, Bok choy with shitake mushrooms (not sure how the mushrooms get so damn addictive), and the Salt & Pepper prawns.

I'm looking forward to trying other items. 

Since the menu is so extensive, there are some items that aren't as stellar. The deep fried avocado eggroll was not my favorite (the middle was still cold). 

Warning, the portions are massive.

It isn't a 'nice' place but a fun one and the host is super friendly and accommodating. I would suggest dine-in or take out. It is BYOB so a fun place to pair beer or wine with American Chinese food.
author: MJ C.

description: Wanted to try out this place from reading the reviews..sorry folks but not for me..the food here  was not as good as some of the places that I have eaten before..the people are friendly, and the service was good..hence the 3 stars ..but the food was just average we ordered bbq pork fried rice..sweet n sour pork..chicken chow mein..Mongolian beef n potstickers..we liked the potstickers..we usually finish the food but not this time around..
author: Jo S.

description: The food from Kung food is simply fantastic. I love the combination fried rice extra spicy and the spring rolls
author: Uly O.

description: Love this place. I've only been about 3 times and they already know me by name. Small joint but great food and service. They are so polite and considerate unlike some other places. Reason why it's a 4/5 stars is cause their lemon chicken was overcooked when I got it as takeout that I couldn't even eat it but this has only happened once.
author: Carsyn T.

description: I've generally had great experiences with Kung Food delivery, but tonight was really disappointing. I ordered by phone and was told it would be 45 minutes to an hour for delivery (I live 5 minutes away, max). When I called and said it'd been 1.5 hours since I ordered, at first there was concern, but when she checked the order time and it was only 1 hour and 20 minutes, I was told it would be here in "5 minutes" and basically hung up on.
author: Amy L.

description:
I think I wanted to like this place since the reviews are high but I have to say the standard of food is subpar for me. 

When you eat restaurant dishes most of the time you know if they really thought about how your food will be received by the consumer. I ordered their beef chow fun and the noodles were very stuck together so that the sauce that should evenly spread only covered the outer parts of the noodles that were exposed. The clumps of noodles that were completely white from lack of sauce unfortunately made the dish bland and lack flavor. It would have been a great dish if it was cooked more thoroughly.

Second the salt and pepper pork chops- I usually love this dish although it's super greasy.. The cook did not know how to rid the smell of pork from the meat. Usually when you cook pork you hope that they were able to use garlic or ginseng or whatever other method to make sure it won't smell or taste the distinct smell that pork meat has -- or maybe the meat itself wasn't fresh. I had a piece and everything else into waste. 

Pork buns - pretty good but the sauce was overly too sweet and starchy for me.
author: Sarah K.

description: Had decent experiences here in the past but could not be more unhappy with my latest delivery. After waiting 1.5 hours for it to arrive was hoping for something worth the wait. But nah. Ordered eggplant dish asking for no oil and literally poured 1/3 cup of pure grease out of the dish before I could even touch it. Ordered pot stickers to go with it and got plain fried wontons. No filling, anything. Just crunchy flavorless fried stuff.  They did nail the brown rice tho.
author: Krissy G.

description: Our family loves this place for both eat in (small and cozy) and delivery. It is family run and they really take care with the food. Highly recommend the spring rolls but everything is good. Lots of vegetarian options!
author: Effie F.

description:
I came here today in this rainy day. I'm fighting a cold and I ordered the won ton soup. The lady at the front was a doll, very professional and courtesy. She said she hoped that I feel better that was very sweet of her. The soup was very tasty had the right amount of chicken, veggies and won ton it it. I ordered a small since I don't have much of an appetite. The price is great for those on a budget. They have a take out menu and they deliver. The soup made me feel a little better on this cold rainy day in San Francisco. If your in the neighborhood do stop by. The ambiance is very intimate and quiet.

2-2-16:

I came here today for lunch with two girlfriends. The food was delicious! I had the beef broccoli. My friends had a different dish that had beef in it. We loved the food. Very tasty and the lunch special prices can't be beat. They played awesome background music classic R&B and hip hop from the 90s. I can't wait to go back!
author: Kiana D.

description: Best Chinese food I've ever had! Friendly, welcoming environment and great service. The chicken fried rice was packed with flavor and not greasy at all. The Mongolian beef was also wonderful. My kids and I loved the dumplings. My kids can't wait to come back. Whenever we visit SF again, Kung Food will be a must stop. Uncle Lo's cooking was masterful.
author: Janet S.

description: Just ordered food for delivery from here. The general tso's chicken had a hair in it, the Korean chicken wings were soggy and did not have any crunch or sweet flavor to them, and the pan fried noodles weren't even edible and the chicken on them was cold and bland. This place is not good.
author: Phoenix W.

description:
Food and atmosphere are great here! Prices are reasonable as well. You get a lot for your money. Possibly the best spring rolls I've ever had. Hot and sour soup was on point and the Mongolian beef, epic! Staff was as friendly and attentive as can be. 
Five stars all day.
author: Dustin S.

description: This place is amazing,  visiting in SF and choose this place and i do not regret it !! AMAZING ! There wonton beef soup is amazing !!!
author: Janeth G.

description:
I have never had a bad experience with the food here. Eat in, Pick Up, or Delivery - this place has the Freshest and Most non soggy, greasy Chinese food I have ever had in SF !! 

Chicken Chow Mein, Walnut Prawns, Egg Rolls, Pot Stickers, Broccoli Beef...doesn't matter what you order, it's the Bomb ALWAYS !!!  

They aren't open on Mondays, so order 2 days worth of food on Sunday, or Literally STARVE yourself Till Tuesday when you have the chance to order !! Totes worth it.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Came here for lunch, really large portions.. love the option of adding fried rice or chow mein for $1 the chow mein and fried rice additions were both delicious the Kung Pao I had was pretty good not too spicy but a little runny for my tastes

My girlfriend got the cashew chicken which was also a huge portion and very tasty a good amount of cashews.

I would definitely come back here and I will also be trying to order for delivery one thing I will say negative is stay away from the pot stickers.

The potstickers were very doughy and gummy and did not have very much filling inside them. They were also pretty greasy. 

I'd much rather have a smaller pot sticker with better meat to pot sticker ratio. The inside of the pot sticker was kinda mushy and not like a cooked sausage texture. 

Either way a great addition to the neighborhood and very reasonably priced good job guys!
author: Jeremy R.

description: My favorite takeout in town. Big portions, not greasy, on time delivery. Love the veggie chow mein, fried rice, general tso's chicken, tofu and green beans. Not a fan of black pepper beef though; meat is tough. I know this is Americanized Chinese food but still tastes good and is so much better than Panda Express.
author: Susan H.

description:
Our neighborhood has been in need of a place like this for years, great new spot! The food is really delicious and very reasonably priced.

The owner, Andy, is awesome! He and the staff put a lot of effort into making you happy and feel welcome.

Favorite dishes so far: Dragon Beef, Korean Wings, all the appetizers, String Beans, chow fun

The lunch deal is great too, plenty of food and really cheap
author: Ian F.

description:
We got Kung Fooled! So overrated.

Ordered Our staple order,: General Tsaos Chicken: good sauce but chicken was dry, had way too much breading, and just wasn't a good texture. Maybe the meat-less version is better?

Chicken Chow Mein: needed soy sauce, probably the better thing we ordered, not great though.

Pork dumplings: wtf. Crazy thick dumpling and no dipping sauce? They gave us -- and I'm not even kidding -- a little thimble sized container of lemon water.  It had a lemon seed in it and everything. Why do I need that? They also gave some chili oil....but no gyoza or dumpling sauce. That's like the best part! Thank goodness I have my own at home....

Stick to Wonderland on Haight n Fillmore. By far our fave!
author: Sabrina S.

description:
Food (4/5): I've been here a couple times now, and both times I really enjoyed the food. Last time my bf and I shared the honey walnut prawns, roast duck, and string beans with lamb. Everything was really flavorful and well prepared, and I would definitely order any of those dishes again.

Service (5/5): The owner is so nice! He always keeps your water/tea filled, which is a huge plus for me haha. He also accommodated our friend who came later just to hang out - even though our friend didn't order anything, the owner still brought him a chair, tea, and a fortune cookie at the end of the meal. 

Value (5/5): Portions are huge. Dishes are meant to be family style, so I'd recommend getting at least two to try out - if you get rice on the side, you'll definitely have enough for dinner. The three dishes plus a bowl of rice lasted me and my bf for two meals for $44 total, and we were stuffed.

This place also does takeout! Most customers we saw were just in to pick up their orders.
author: Abby S.

description: Order delivery and never showed up. Disappointing. No contact from kung food not answering inquiring phone calls. Avoid this place.
author: Ray S.

description: Nice place to have dinner with friends...! Nice customer services!! Don't miss out! I will come back next time.
author: Zheng Zhang J.

description:
My buddy and I came here on a Thursday night around 8pm.  No line, that's a definite plus, but that also makes me wonder if the food is any good.  Fortunately, I found out it is.  Food is delicious and well priced.  My buddy got the mongolian lamb and I got the pan fried noodles with beef.  Service was great too and they heeded my request to go easy on the salt by lessening the sauce poured in.  The owner is super friendly and accomodating.  Funny thing is when we left around 9, the place was much livelier and most tables were occupied.  

Good, cheap chinese food without the hole in the wall ambiance.  I highly recommend trying
author: Victor C.

description:
First time here! I Yelped Chinese Food in the area. This place came up and I am so glad I tried them out. Inside of restaurant is small and very clean.
Food was fresh and hot.
I ordered Tomato Beef Chow Mein I will say it is very good.
My co-workers ordered the Spring Rolls. Nice and crispy.
Sweet and Sour Chicken and Chow mein lunch special. Very good and plenty of meat.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE. Get the crab Rangoon. 
This place is very clean and the staff is so friendly. They also gave free delivery which you just can't beat. Good bang for your buck.
author: Jenna G.

description: My favorite Chinese food place ever! It gets busy during lunch hours but the great service and great food and it's totally worth the wait.
author: Simon S.

description:
Had a pretty good dinner here. Enjoyed the tomato beef chow mein and my friend has the basil chicken.
I can definitely see myself coming here again.
The staff was friendly and attentive. While we were there, several people came in to pick up takeout orders and there was a delivery person in and out a few times as well.
author: Rachel M.

description: Tastes like shit.  I've tried eating from this place in multiple times but every single time it's disgusting. Somehow they're always customers in there, that fact will never cease to amaze me
author: David S.

description:
Kung Food is the best Chinese food in the area. I had the chicken chow mein, orange chicken and rice and it was truly delightful. This is definitely my new Chinese food spot.

The only reason why I've docked them one star is because their hours aren't the best. I mean lets be real.. We all know Chinese food tastes best after 10pm.
author: Jalahn W.

description: I tried it a 2nd time since it said they had made a change to their salt & pepper pork chops, BIG MISTAKE!!! Delivery was very much on time and guy totally sweet BUT never again!!!!
author: Lissette T.

description:
Thought this place was sort of a joke initially, American Chinese food and all, but I was set straight when I decided to give it a try.

This food is good.  Totally worth it - even though it's American.
author: Steve F.

description: Very good food and very affordable!! Small place only like 4-5 tables. Come when they first open and you will get a table!!
author: Margaret L.

description:
I figured I'd write this review while my food is in the trash and the awful experience is fresh in my mind. There are a few Chinese restaurants in the city I usually order them but today I decided to try something new. I find myself hungry, upset that I wasted $17(tip included), and wishing I had ordered from somewhere else. 
 
The service I received was horrible. That alone is enough to stop me from ever ordering there again. I wish that was all that was wrong because the way I see it even though the lack of customer service would have made sure this would the first and last time I ever gave them my money I would have decent or good food. Unfortunately, that was not the case.

I ordered the orange chicken lunch special with a side of fried rice and an order of vegetable pot stickers. The pot stickers were deep-fried, which was unexpected but I was curious to try. They were rubbery and flavorless. The fried rice was so salty I could taste nothing else. The orange chicken was tough and dry. I could only stomach a few bites of both. Just because I was hungry doesn't mean I was going subject myself to that. I didn't try the soup that came with the meal out of fear of what it might taste like. The only decent thing was the free egg roll.
author: Angee R.

description: Cute ambiance not to far from my house. Owner is friendly and there wasn't a wait at 7pm on a Saturday. We ordered orange chicken and combination chow fun. The chicken was delicious and slightly crispy. So was the chow fun except I docked a star since it was slightly saltier than what I'm used to. Otherwise a solid Chinese restaurant!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Great food, great prices, great delivery.

We went with the Korean BBQ wings, Hunan Butter Beef (highly recommended on Yelp and didn't disappoint) and the spicy shrimp chow mein. 

Everything was really great overall and the delivery was right on time.
author: Keith B.

description:
This place is great. I eat here once a week and get the General Tso's chicken with broccoli. Crispy, just the right amount of sweet, not greasy. Andy's super friendly. 

I hope they open more locations!
author: Josh J.

description:
How many times have we ordered delivery from Kung Food? Probably like 15+.... Plus the several times we've dined in. 

This is a good addition to the Divis corridor, which is somewhat lacking in Asian restaurants. It's a pretty typical American Chinese place and definitely does a good job of that. I recommend the walnut shrimp, crispy dragon skin (beef), and general tso's chicken. Their chow fun is also good though a little greasy, and their Singapore fried noodles are also good with lots of meat. Salted fish fried rice is good too.

Customer service is friendly and fast. I highly recommend ordering from this place both for food and ease of use.
author: J L.

description: Love these guys. Food is fresh, high quality, and got here in 20 minutes one time. Prawns with veggies is my usual. Plenty of big prawns, plenty of fresh crispy veggies. Bay Love
author: Legion S.

description: This was a good little hole in the wall Chinese restaurant on Divisadero Street. We were craving chinese so decided to stop by and when we walked up the scent of delicious Chinese food surrounded us. There was a small line since the restaurant in its self is small. I would definitely not recommend for more than 4 people. They have only a handful of tables and most of the time they had to put them together for larger parties which would cause a larger line. The food was good and flavorful. While you are waiting in line they let you order so that by the time you are seated your food is ready. Thankfully when we finally got seated after 30 minutes our food showed up within 5 minutes. You could see that a lot of locals love the place by the memorization of their names by the hostess. Many people ordered for delivery or take out which is probably what we should have done. Overall a great experience and would highly recommend to try out.
author: Melanie B.

description:
I've been to this place twice since they opened down the street from where I live and the food is delicious. 

The portions here are very generous and our server, who I believe to be the son of the family that owns the restaurant, was very friendly and informative. He recommended a special that I believe was called the butter beef: tender sautéed filet mignon with greens and scallion, this dish blew my mind. My other go tos are the BBQ pork fried rice, Generals chicken, Mongolian beef, and Hot & Sour soup. Nothing disappointed!
author: Jenee Y.

description: The food was delicious and not greasy at all.  I liked how their hot mustard and chili oil was made fresh and not in packets.  We did take-out and they were friendly and efficient and our order was ready when they said it would be.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Pure awesomeness, great customer service, quality music selection. Will  Return next time in town, such quality and delicious food.
author: Ig L.

description:
What does it all mean?  

Can there be good food, good service, and a good price?  Do you have to choose any 2? 

At 1 pm on a Saturday My Love and I walked in.  It was calm and quiet, unlike the construction up the street, which we hardly heard inside.  It was uncrowded, unlike the southern cafe down the street, where 14 people waited patiently behind crowd control cords.  Casually, we picked an empty table in one of the windows and accepted the staff's immediate attention.  

The room, which seats 20, was decorated in lacquered wood, prosperity cats, and lucky bamboo.  The menu was nicely bound in hardback.  It was time to try the food and see what was up.  

My Love chose the sweet & sour chicken, and I decided to try the cumin beef, because I hadn't heard of it.  Cumin is a primary ingredient in most curries, and I knew this would have a distinctive, wake-up twist.  As advertised, this was not your classical Chinatown fare.  The names were the same, but the grease was gone.  The cumin beef was billed as a hot dish, and I did find plenty of peppers in it.  I managed to keep the heat down to something my tongue could cope with by setting the peppers aside, but it was still tasty and it still gave my mouth a buzz.  

Included with the main dish were sweet & sour soup, steamed rice, an egg roll, tea, and a fortune cookie.  Seriously.  A fortune cookie.  

Somewhere in the middle of the lunch I decided to order a diet Coke, which helped me manage the heat of the main dish.  

All of it was great!  The attentive waitstaff was great!  Not hearing the construction outside was great!  Watching people on the sidewalk, as they peered through the window to see what this place was like, was great! 

I was thrilled with the food and service.  Anxiously I anticipated the check.  Would it be $60? $70?  But no, it was just $18 + tip!  For 2 giant delicious lunches!  That's great! 

So the answer is you can have it all!  We took a menu home (they deliver, which is great!), and we will return.
author: David D.

description: Best Chinese food I've had in San Francisco.
author: Dick C.

description:
Update
Both DH and I got terrible stomach problems late night after eating the delivery food from Kung Food - spent much of that night and the next morning alternating runs to the bathroom I don't think it was bad food, as the ingredients seemed extra fresh, but it was either the bite of potstickers we each had before realizing they were gross, or just the extra oil in the fried food. Either way something is very wrong in the kitchen.
author: Roberta D.

description: This is a great affordable Chinese joint, with lots of options for vegetarians. My partner and I had a great dinner here, adn the owner was so cool and nice. I really appreciate that they have fake meat stuff.
author: Mark S.

description:
Mesmerized by this new Hole-in-the-Wall foodie spot. Not only is the owner an amateur Chinese rapper who serves amazing Chinese food, this restaurant plays some pretty neat contemporary hiphop Chinese music.  

My wife and I ordered the Black Pepper Steak. The steak was amazingly flavorful, cooked to a masterful perfection of medium rare tenderness. Chinese people can be very serious about the selection of prime cuts and how steak is done!! We also ordered this meatless dish (String Bean with Meatless Prawn) to see how this restaurant accommodated to the needs of vegetarians. Simply amazing; even an infamous carnivore such as myself finished all the string beans. The vegan prawn tasted like prawn despite being made from flour (no pun intended).  

Finally the owner greeted our table in a very cordial manner and introduced himself.  He explained how it took him nearly three years to realize his dream of opening his very own restaurant, and that he has two passions in life--food and music. This restaurant is a paradigm example of one of those hole-in- the-wall restaurants dispersed throughout SF. This genre of owners have other passions in life besides unscrupulously operating their businesses to maximize profits and $$$$. I believe when one operates a business out of passion and in pursuit of other dreams in life, the products and services are always exceptionally remarkable. Kung Food is clearly different from large chain restaurants that only want your $$$$.

Once in a rare blue moon, I experienced the warmth of dining as a welcomed and cherished patron. People always talk about one of those renowned hole-in-the-wall Italian Restaurants in SF and its unusually hospitable owner. Well now we have a new Chinese version of such a restaurant. No question, this restaurant fully deserves the full 5-star rating.
author: Justin H.

description:
This restaurant is not your ordinary Asian restaurant. It's a star in the making.The service and the quality of the food was a welcomed surprise. 

I love the friendly service, the fresh taste of the food, the generous portions, and the affordable prices. After ordering a rice noodle dish, one of the staffers suggested that I try their mango and prawn rice noodle dish that wasn't offered on the menu. The dish was fabulous. The prawns were fresh, the sesame veggies were crisp, and the mango pieces were perfectly ripe. (I don't even like mangoes!) 

Highly recommend this gem! Don't forget to ask for suggestions from the staffers!
author: Bren K.

description: So thrilled for the new addition to the neighborhood. The owner personally greeted me when I picked up my take out order. He seems as thrilled as I do that he's opened in the neighborhood. I got the beef chow main. One benchmark by which I judge any chinese restaurant and they passed with flying colors. I then came back for lunch and have the general sows chicken. It was crispy and perfectly cooked. The sauce was delicious with a little bit of spice and not too sweet. A heaping portion of rice, a little eggroll and an egg drop soup for the amazing price of $7.75. So I plan to come back and make myself a regular and start eating there for lunch all the time because everyone there is so friendly and  the interior makes it a delightful little spot.
author: David A R.

description:
A fair step above most cheap Chinese places. Best part: You don't sacrifice your wallet for quality Chinese food. However, Beware their portions.... You should come hungry if it's for lunch. 
We came around noon - 7 bucks for a huge entree and rice. Highly recommend paying the extra dollar for chow mein or fried rice. Both are stellar. 
We took leftovers to the Golden Gate park for a picnic. 
A great place for people like me who value quantity and affordability (not to mention taste).
author: William B.

description:
This place is great for vegetarians and vegans! The ingredients are listed on the menu to assure you that certain dishes do not contain any animal products. Additionally, the portions are huge, so you can easily squeak two meals out of one entree. 

For an appetizer, my boyfriend and I got the vegetable spring rolls. Pretty simple: shredded cabbage and carrots, but the dipping sauce (a sweet chili sauce?) was amazing.  For an entree, I ordered the Sesame Meatless Chicken with Broccoli, which was so yum. My boyfriend had the Kung Pao Meatless Prawns, which was also very good. It came with lots of sauteed veggies (peppers and onions) in a light sauce. The meatless prawns looked like actual prawns, which always freaks me out since I've never eaten seafood, but they were really good nonetheless. I'm really impressed that this restaurant decided to offer something other than tofu or meatless chicken. 

I don't think they have any vegan options for dessert, but you do get unlimited hot tea with your meal, which was a nice bonus.

I definitely plan to go back soon, and when I do, I think I'm going for the General Tso or the Lemon Meatless Chicken. I'll let you know ;-)
author: Kelly L.

description:
Great service, consistently good food, quickly prepared, and nice atmosphere. Andy and the staff at Kung Food always brighten my day because they are so positive and friendly. The food portions are large and yummy, leaving plenty of leftovers. The lunch specials are a great deal. 

A little room for improvement: $5.50 for 3 soup dumplings (although they are delicious and served at the right temperature) is too high, many dim sum items come 3 to an order which is no fun when you're splitting with 1 other person, and the pot stickers are the thick doughy kind I don't like as much.
author: Emma L.

description:
I am a big fan of this place. It fills a gaping hole in the available options around Divis, and the food is very solid for the price. Simple solid Chinese food; the dude serving it is not twirling a waxed mustachio for better or for worse.

Dry fried long beans, Lemon prawns and Eggplant with Chicken and Prawns were all tasty without being overly heavy. I am enjoying traipsing through their lunch menu.
author: Donald C.

description: Portions are great! Loved there mixed seafood soup! Love ordering take out here. Delivery as scheduled. Didn't come with rice though. That was a surprise
author: O K.

description: Basic Chinese take out, best in the area. Inexpensive, generous portions. Probably worth it to go out to sunset or richmond for the real deal but this is great for what it is advertised as.
author: Ron M.

description: This not good Chinese food. The General Tsao chicken was so tough and dry that I could not eat it - it ended up in the trash. The Chow Mein was bland. I don't see how this gets 4.5 stars.
author: Morris R.

description: This is my go-to spot for Chinese food. The service is super fast and the staff is friendly. There's always a long line at the door but it moves fast.
author: Janes R.

description:
Heaping portions of tasty fresh Chinese food. Truly a welcome spot in the neighborhood. Andy, the owner, could not be friendlier. I actually look forward to walking over and picking up my general tso's chicken for the warm friendly vibes at Kung Food. 

Really rooting for the success of Andy, his family and his delicious food.
author: caileen K.

description:
My husband and I tried this place out for the first time last night. We live in the neighborhood & were happy to see a new affordable restaurant in the area open up. We had the avocado egg rolls, sweet & sour chicken, Hunan spicy dragon beef, and chicken fried rice. I'd say it was good but not 5 stars amazing. I'm a bit perplexed by so many 5 star reviews. Maybe people are just happy it's not another pizza place? 

Our favorites were the spicy dragon beef & avocado egg rolls; the sweet and sour chicken was a bit bland & dry, and the chicken fried rice seemed a little bit dry too but edible. Given they've only been open a week I'm a bit more forgiving, but definitely not blown away. I'm sure they will do well as there are no options for Chinese food in the neighborhood, but I think we'll stick with Wonderland Chinese food in the lower Haight...maybe try them again in a few months.
author: Desiree P.

description: I've struggled to find good Chinese food in San Francisco, despite it boasting one of the first Chinatowns in the US. Kung Food is located out in the Haight and its unassuming atmosphere is deceiving. My boyfriend and I tried an assortment of dishes that were both authentic and delicious. The salted fish fried rice came in a giant portion, but wasn't at all greasy or too salty. The basil chicken was just the right amount of spicy and had a good ratio of meat to vegetables. I also loved the mushu chicken, although would recommend just eating stir fry alone as their pancakes are a little dried out. All in all, if I'm looking for quick, satisfying Chinese food, Kung Food is my new go to!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Got a delivery, timing is good. the owner drove here. liked the food, hot and fresh.

Always go there whenever i need sth fast hot and delicious.
author: Tan D.

description: Solid Chinese takeout with good delivery times. Crisp and fresh with generous servings and a range of dishes better than the average American Chinese food. Multiple low carb options with green beans, lettuce cups many awesome tofu dishes. Portions are huge, dishes easily feed 2 meals or more.
author: Amaya B.

description: HORRIBLE experience. We ordered for delivery and the food never arrived. We called the restaurant to check in the order after an hour and they assured us it was coming, but an hour later it had still never arrived. Then they stopped answering their phone.
author: Julie K.

description: Ordered the pan fried noodles (vegetarian) and felt incredibly nauseous/generally ill for the rest of the night;  thought it might be a fluke but my friend ate some of the leftovers a few hours later and had the same reaction. The food was good, but there's little reason for a vegetarian dish to make you sick. People clearly like this place, and it's definitely a good value, but I'm pretty put off after this experience.
author: Ann C.

description: Easily the best Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. Every-single-time they're consistent, service is awesome, and the food is delicious. The lead server is always happy to greet people as they enter and is timely with table needs... Highly recommend - won't be disappointed!
author: Chris T.

description: Stopped in for a quick lunch and found out about them from yelp. Soooo much food for the lunch price. It's amazing! Great food, good service, more than fair prices..keep up the good work!
author: Joe B.

description: Love this place!  We found it on accident one day but have been back several times since.  The people are super friendly and the food is great.  Check out the wings, so good!
author: Anne B.

description:
Living in the Nopa/Castro area we have been waiting for a good Chinese food restaurant. Kung Food placed a flyer at our door so figured we would check it out. 

Tonight we ordered the following:

Mu Shu Pork: bland, far too much cabbage with large pieces that broke through the pancake.

Crispy Dragon Beef: not too bad but perhaps too crispy, making it over cooked. 

Crab Rangoon: seemed fresh but undercooked, the dough was soft, and not crispy. The crab tasted like imitation crab. Sadly, I asked for extra hot mustard when ordering. The lady that answered confirmed extra hot mustard but unfortunately no mustard was delivered at all. 

We got a free fried rice with the order but it lacked flavor, was dry, and clumpy. 

Ultimately we were disappointed with the meal. The order did not come as expected (no hot mustard), they do not deliver chopsticks, they do not deliver soy sauce or hot sauce. The food was desperate for seasoning.

Everything tasted like it was cooked earlier and mildly re-heated. Perhaps if they cut the menu in half and focused on clean, fresh, ingredients, the food would be better.
author: William R.

description: Brought some out of town family there for dinner (was my first time too), I think between the 6 of us we ordered half the menu and had leftovers for daaays!! Good portion sizes, Great (super friendly!) service and the kitchen was lightning fast, priced right and dang tasty - not overly salty dishes and plenty of vegetarian 'meats' for me to choose from (and had the good kind of brown rice if you don't care for white).  We loved it all!  My partner and I are looking forward to going back.
author: gina b.

description: Best service, delicious food, warm atmosphere. I can't rave about this place enough. Love it!
author: Jay F.

description:
1st - You have to know that there's MSG in the food.  
2nd - Taste is OK - not great.  There are crappier Chinese delivery places in the Inner Richmond / Inner Sunset.
Delivery was on time and food was hot so thumbs up!
Probably wont be back for a while.
author: Tom L.

description: DO NOT WAIST your Time! Came here 45 minutes prior to closing requested a table for 5 and was told we are only doing take out! Totally unprofessional and inconsiderate of the fact that I called previously and took an uber there! If you don't want to waste your time or money on HORRIBLE service AVOID this place!!!
author: L M.

description: One of the best Chinese restaurants in the Bay Area. Had Hong Kong style chow mien and it was awesome! Their chicken is very delicious too. The staff is nice too. Tipped $20 because it's too good and they deserve it!
author: Jan Carlo G.

description:
I generally crave chow fun or pan fried noodles when I'm craving Chinese food... Decided to take a chance on delivery after reading reviews.  (This was delivered to my kaiser room today as I'm in the hospital this week.)

Chow fun:  they did exactly as I requested... No meat, but add eggplant, bamboo shoot and basil to my veggie chow fun.... Amazing!  I loved all the veggies they put in!  Noodles were wide, flat, soft and fresh!  Yes, some noodles stuck together it I liked that there wasn't too much soy sauce on it so I can taste the veggies.  The only thing I wish was that it had the wok cooked flavor.  4.5 stars!

Basil eggplant, chicken and prawn:  lots better than I thought!  Eggplant was cooked perfectly, chicken was soft juicy white meat slices and huge prawns!!  (Most Asian places charge $3 extra for any dish adding shrimp... And they add 2-3 small sized shrimp to the dish.). Looks oily, but it didn't taste it... Most of what looks like oil is the liquid from the eggplant. 5 stars!

Korean style chicken wings:  this being take out I wanted to make sure my wings stayed crispy so I asked for it dry and the sauce on the side.  Chicken was perfect... Crispy outside, juicy tender meat inside.  Sauce was yummy but way too much!  (I hate wasting food and ended up dumping about 90% of it). Only complaint is I requested extra spicy and the sauce wasn't spicy at all.  Really wish they kept the garnish in the sauce so I still got that flavor.. (Add pepper and green onions to sauce and sesame seeds to wings and it'll be a 5 star dish)  4.5 stars!

Will definitely order again!  Love the fact that min delivery is only $15!  Huge portions!
author: Diana L.

description:
This place has great staff, good food (and lots of it) and it's pretty cheap! I love this place. My husband and I like the crispy Mongolian beef on the lunch menu and between the sweet and sour soup beforehand and the entree they give us enough to share and still be full. Plus the wait staff are always so attentive and kind. And accommodating. I am gluten intolerant and they were helpful in helping me find a menu item that I could eat, but most of their stuff is fried with potato starch instead of wheat flour.
It doesn't look like much from the outside, and it's in an out-of-the-spotlight location, but Kung Food is a little gem!
author: Adrienne D.

description: We ordered delivery to quench a craving and try Kung Food for the first time.  We got the Hunan Grilled Butter Beef, Asparagus in Black Bean Sauce, and Wontons.  O-M-Yummy! That was really good and totally worth it. The beef was tender and very flavorful. The wontons were crispy, not what I had expected but sooo good!
author: Cristina C.

description: My go to Chinese delivery!!! The chicken fried rice is so so good. The candied walnut shrimp is pretty good too. Everything is always warm when it arrives and typically it doesn't take toooo long to get here. Only once was my order slightly wrong, but they corrected it easily.
author: Shawn T.

description: This is my new GO TO CHINESE FOOD FOR DELIVERY!!!  You can tell that they use fresh ingredients & don't go super heavy on the oil.  We ordered the Hunan Butter Beef (my #1), Chicken Lo Mein (HUGE chunks of chicken and delicious), Lemon Chicken (#2 favorite), beef & broccoli (my kids favorite) and we got a free pork fried rice.  Seriously the best Chinese food I've had in a while.  My husband said the owners were locals which makes me love this place more - I want to support my hometown peeps!  Delivery was swift and I am still dreaming of the food.
author: stephany m.

description: Any and all dishes so far are great, never disappointed in quality/taste of food. Delivery is a bit slow, expect 60-75 minutes during lunch and dinner. Order before you are really hungry...but when it does arrive you'll be happy.
author: Mario V.

description:
I LOVE KUNG FOOD!

I went to Kung Food Saturday night with my boyfriend. My boyfriend lives only a block away from Kung Food and before that, there were no Chinese restaurants in that neighborhood. Not really sure why. We were hesitant to try it at first but one day decided to give it a shot. For appetizers, we got the Korean chicken wings and dim sum combination plate. They were so freaking good. We got our food in less than 10 minutes, including our main entrée.

For the main entrée, we got the Hunan Crispy Dragon Beef. It was so delicious that I had dreams about it that night. For $9.75, the portion was enough to feed like 3 people. We had eaten so much but still had plenty of leftovers for the next day. 

Service was excellent. Andy is so nice and he gives the best customer service ever. He is always smiling and very polite. 

I'd also like to mention that I left my debit card here and when I came back the next day, the cashier gave it to me. I was very impressed with the honesty of the people working here.

Andy, I read your comments regarding the one star reviews you got. I feel you!!! Don't mind the haters as your restaurant will be very successful. 

I cannot wait to go back to this place. I'm pretty sure I will be back this week. =)
author: Iya J.

description: A-mazing!! Mango chicken is good and spicy. The Spicy calamari roll thing (I do not know the name). Everything we had a good. It's a quaint place with great, relaxed service. We will be back. Thanks again Kung Food!
author: Shayna C.

description:
Great little spot just off of Divis with prices that would make you think SF *isn't really* being taken over by new money. Service was perfect - kind and courteous without being in-your-face, so my friend and I got everything we needed when we needed it, plus had a relaxing conversation over dinner. We didn't feel rushed at all even though the place is pretty small and could easily get a 'dinner rush'. Decor is adorable... a mix of traditional Chinese with bits of urban flair. 
The food is on point with just the right balance of spice and savory flavor - across the board with either veggies, tofu or meat (hard to find places that get all 3 right). The Sweet & Sour Chicken ROCKS, the Basil Tofu will go to any vegetarian's heart, and the Combination Plate is where it's at. Beware that portions are HUGE: I stuffed myself at dinner with my friend and evenly split the leftovers with my boyfriend the next day. It was awesome. 
Thanks for being a great staple in the neighborhood! I'll definitely be going here any time I crave Chinese food.
author: Eileen T.

description: By far the best Chinese food in the city, hands down. Everything I ordered was delicious. I can wait to come back. Andy is the best waiter ever, he is also the owner with his sister Jaime. The Grand Opening was a success, this will quickly become the "it" spot, mark my words.
author: Edwardo P.

description:
I finally tried Kung a week or so ago and overall it was a great meal!  The chicken chow mein and sesame chicken were well executed with good flavor.  Also was a very hearty serving!

Unfortunately, the korean chicken wings are where expectations fell short.  I'm hoping it was just an off night, but the wings were sooooo salty!  I was hoping for a sweet/spicy combination but all I could taste was salt.  Husband usually likes things on the salty side, but even he agreed that it was way too salty.  We ended up eating only a couple of wings :(
author: Susan Y.

description:
I've worked in the area for almost a year, and this is probably the first time a Chinese restaurant has opened its doors. My first thought upon seeing the burgandy sign post of Kung Food was, "F yes, no more Popeye Tuesdays!" 

Before I could even mention about the place to my coworkers, they were already talking about going there a second time, saying that the food was great and the price was absurdly affordable. Great and affordable, in this area? That hardly computes given the hefty sum I would have to pay from Bi-rite and Faletti's to satiate my appetite. Ever the skeptic, I went with two coworkers during lunch break to see it for myself.

What I expected: A small business with take-out boxes lined up to the ceiling, with buffet-like counter reminiscent of Panda Express and people meandering through single-profile line with barely any place to sit down. Maybe some "NO PANDA ALLOWED" signs for kicks

What I got: A snug little place by the bus stop with just enough seats for twenty people, a nicely lit table for four by the windows, and a menu with more dishes and choices than 90% of the Chinese restaurants I've been to. No pandas sighted, what a relief! The interior design was simple but didn't feel empty. The menu was INSANE, definitely affordable for the portions serviced. The service from owner and waiter, Andy, and his sister Jaime, were on point, efficient, and professional while their attitude and approach were cool and friendly.

I could go on about the quality of the food and the service, but that would be a bit overwhelming, and one of the earlier reviewers have already done a very constructive critical analysis. So I'll just say, it was a lot better than what I expected. I have great hopes for the restaurant's growth potential in a place ruled by cheap fast food and expensive and decent-to-good edibles.

Come and experience it for yourself. This is not Panda Express, but pretty close to real Chinese cuisine.
author: James L.

description: Great service eating in. Enjoyed all the entrees we ordered...especially loved the hot n sour soup. Large portions and reasonably priced. They do not serve beer or wine anymore but you can bring your own. Was told $1 for a beer or $5 for a bottle of wine.
author: Daniel A.

description:
THE best New Chinese food in town !!

Not that I am an epicure or a picky foodie, but I can easily discern that Kung Food is different from others. I'm not sure whether it's the hiphop music they play, the new age interior decor, the food itself, or a combination of it all. The owner is young and stylish and wants patrons to enjoy a comfortable dining experience. 


The food tasted great without excessive grease or any sign of MSG. Also, don't forget to try their friend banana dessert. 


I will definitely return to this restaurant again both for the food and dine-in experience. I already asked the restaurant management about their catering service. The owner even said that, for catering, I can request dishes not in their menu, and Kung Food will make it for us. I am definitely looking forward to their catering services
author: Lin X.

description: We live in Buena Vista Terrace area and are always looking for good delivery food. We ended up trying Kung Food and we were not disappointed. The delivery service was fast (compared to other food delivery). Food was hot and tasty! And the portions are huge! Would recommend.
author: Pstephan A.

description:
This review is based on there customer service I received at Kung Food.  In a word, outstanding.  Eat24 processed an order (and charged my credit card), however, when I placed the order the restaurant was closing and their delivery staff had left for the afternoon.   It took Eat24 50 minutes to contact the owner of the restaurant, Andy.  Btw - I have yet to receive any response from Eat24.

Andy apologized, made sure Eat24 was aware of he situation and to cancel the order.  Andy even texted me a screed shot of the order.  Still wanting to try Kung Food, I decided to have the food delivered after 5pm (once they reopened for dinner).  Andy texted me, said he's got my order and will deliver by 5:40 pm.  ANDY he threw in a free fried rice for my trouble.... And it wasn't his fault!  

I'm totally blown away and cannot wait to try the food - stay tuned :-).... I'll update in a bit.
author: Cindi C.

description:
Finally some Chinese food in the neighborhood!

Couldn't be more excited
-Food is great, especially the sesame chicken sauce! 
-Restaurant is very clean and welcoming
-Staff is very friendly (and just as excited as I am about their being there)
-Lunch specials are cheap! With very large portions
-Broccoli is crisp and fresh
author: Ian P.

description: Food was disgusting!!! Way too dry. Found a hair in my food. Called back to speak with a manager no one could help. I would rather go to golden wok which is rated like 2 stars instead of ever coming to a place like this. They should definitely have a health inspector Coke to this place and check it out. No good please people save your money or go to a fast food place before wasting your time and money here! BAD BAD BAD!!!!!!
author: Roxana J.

description: The food is good, but that's not why I'm writing this review. The guy who runs this place is amazing. He loves running this restaurant and being part of the local community through this restaurant; he's so enthusiastic, happy and passionate. It's a true local feel and personal experience. If you've ever been to a place where you or one of your friends knows the owner and they give you extra special service, that is what this place feels like, but they treat everybody that way. And the portions are huge. I get take out and eat it for 3-4 meals sometimes. Thank you Kung Food! A great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Geoff B.

description: Ordered delivery from their website. After waiting 2 hours I tried calling to cancel and no one answered the phone. Is this place closed for business? If not, it should be. Will need to contact the site for a refund. Ugh.
author: JS K.

description: Meat undercooked in pot stickers.  Salt and pepper tofu soggy.
author: Kandle S.

description: I ordered food delivery from this place few times. It was ok, but nothing makes it stand out from the huge number of other Chinese restaurants. Prices are reasonable, and portions are more than generous. One entree is probably enough to feed two people.
author: Igor P.

description: One of my favorite spots in SF. BYOB, hospitality, bomb food. Should stop there but... That spicy Dragon beef and General Tso goes toe to toe with anywhere. I consider myself somewhat of a General Tso Chicken connoisseur and this could be numero uno in my opinion, but that Spicy Dragon Beef has changed my world of Chinese menu's. I've sat down to eat, the service is fast, and they actually care if you enjoy your meal. The owner has taken the opportunity to know me by name and thank me for my repeat business. This isn't common in 2016. The delivery is even bomb. A lot of times you'll get delivery and it's meh, but Kung Food has this down. The sampler appetizer is so good. The Wings are bomb. I'm going to order them during football season. If you're still reading, you can clearly tell I can't say enough about this place. Kung Food, thank you for opening near my apartment. You guys rock.
author: Keegan E.

description: Just left the best little Chinese restaurant in the entire city. We drove 3 hours from Fresno to enjoy this hidden gem! The staff are courteous and the place is quaint and clean. You can tell In the flavoring that everything is fresh and prepared at the time of ordering. This isn't a typical Chinese place loaded with tons of salt and fat. The veggies are all fresh and the meats are the lean. I have jumped around trying different entrees and have yet to be disappointed. The portions are huge and the pricing is the most reasonable in the whole city. We have begun to make this a monthly outing just to have this excellent food. No joke, worth the drive.
author: Cain A.

description:
My only experiences with this place have been strictly for take out - but the service has always been fast and friendly. First off, San Francisco sucks for food. I know everyone says this is a great place for new culinary experiences but no. You get jipped on everything. (Since when do I have to order rice separate of my chicken tikka masala?! Sacrilege) However, this place reminds me of what it was like ordering food in New York - you actually get a complete meal without going bankrupt. My personal favorites are the sesame and general tso's chicken. They always include a side of steamed white rice free of charge, whether it truly is included or I guess I'm nice enough to get some free rice? Regardless, they've always been lovely to me every time I order. And the food is really good. Every once in awhile I try to break free from my boring healthy habits (I blame you, Barry's Bootcamp) and give in to my cravings. This stuff definitely hits the spot. 
If you dine in, it's quite cozy. As in, there's only a few tables. But it's a cute little spot to grab a quick (yummy) bite then continue on your way.
author: Ali A.

description: Really solid Chinese takeout for the neighborhood, not really much else to say. They're very nice and quick! Food comes family style (as far as I've seen), so you have to order meat, veggies, etc. separately if you want an actual meal (e.g. general tso's chicken is literally all chicken, only chicken, no veggies or anything else in there). This makes ordering for one basically impossible, but it's good food and leaves you with leftovers, I suppose. You're already getting Chinese takeout, might as well get copious amounts from here.
author: Alejandro R.

description: Gave Kung Food a second try. Not bad, fast service. Snow peas were really over cooked, though.
author: Andrea R.

description: Good place, not the best but you will have a decent dinner. Mongolian beef, hot n sour soup is way to go. Also they have really good wings so try those if you are in the mood for wings. Pretty fast service as well!
author: Jeff C.

description:
Great to finally have a Chinese option in this part of town. Right downstairs from where I currently live too.

The restaurant is pretty small, so I would imagine it getting cramped if I visited at a busier time. I'm sure the workers can handle it, but it looked like they had their hands full with orders and attending to customers. They had old Teresa Teng songs playing in the background during my visit, so that was a nice touch.

The folks running the restaurant are very nice and kind. Based on how they treated the other customers waiting for takeout, they seem like the type that will go the distance to make their guests happy. I hope they can keep it up and prosper.

The prices aren't Oakland Chinatown prices, but the food is good and the portions are very hefty. I expected the restaurant and menu to be all hipstery because of the area, but it had a good balance of urban and traditional. The beef w/ scrambled egg felt like home. Not salty but not bland, just the way I like it. They gave me enough for 2 and a half meals. I'll be coming back to try more of my usual dishes but so far it seems like it is one of the better places in the city. It will most likely be my goto place for Chinese whenever I am not in Oakland or too lazy to cook at home.
author: Gilbert T.

description: Sooooooo good! They're salty fish and chicken fried rice is bomb. I took that for take out. I went on Valentine's Day too. I got the walnut prawns and hot and sour soup- DELICIOUS!
author: Joseph A.

description: This place was packed mostly due to it being pretty small has about 8 tables but they sure do make up for the lack of space with their generous plates. I had walnut shrimp it came with 15 shrimps which is rare most I can get for $10 in SF is a dozen. My Husband had the Chef's special Hunan Beef which was delicious I would recommend trying. The chow mein was packed with flavor and was a pretty big portion. Lastly, we had the Korean wings which are sweet I would also recommend. Best Chinese food I've had in a while and fairly priced. Andy, the owner, is so down to earth he accommodated bussed waited and served our table all while handling 6 other tables, phone calls and deliveries.
author: Lainey G.

description: Was excited to try since there isn't much for Chinese food in Nopa area. We were very pleased on the quality, quantity and price of food for the 4 of us. We ordered the hot and sour soup which was good - could have used more sour IMO but better than most places. Ordered string beans and chicken, garlic eggplant and shredded pork. Our favorite wAs the string beans and eggplant.  Service was very friendly despite being very busy. There's not many tables and they do a healthy size to go business. We liked that the portions were generous and that sharing was easy ( no awkward -oh I don't want to take too much). We live in the neighborhood and will definitely be coming back.
author: Puff G.

description: Great small family chinese restaurant for fast pickup if you are hungry after work and don't want to cook or wait. Food is very good and the prices are reasonable.
author: Edita R.

description: Damn good (American) Chinese food! This is by far my favorite delivery place in San Francisco. I always get the Hunan Butter Beef or the Beef & Broccoli, which are both consistently excellent. On slower days, they've arrived with my food 20 minutes after ordering! On busier days, it takes about an hour, but they're upfront about it on the phone before you order, and I'm willing to wait for the quality and quantity of what I get. Per everyone else's reviews, everyone I've spoken with there has always been super nice, which makes it easy to place an order over the phone and get some free chow mein. Highly recommended!
author: Allison M.

description: What a wonderful find in the McAllister Divisadero area. A much needed Asian restaurant in this quaint neighborhood. I ordered the basil beef with fried rice for lunch. Plenty of beef and stirred fried vegetables to please even the faint of heart. The fried rice was perfectly done not too hard and not too mushy. The lunch comes with an egg roll and a bowl of corn soup. Definitely a gem. Get there early to make sure you get a seat otherwise it's a wait for this 20 seater eatery. The wait staff is very attentive and personable too.
author: Michael M.

description: Yelp was TOTALLY wrong on this one. We ordered 3 dishes- one chicken, one beef, and one lamb. Not one of them could three hungry humans finish. I left hungry because I couldn't get myself to keep eating. Very poor meat quality. All three were chewy and stringy. We drove 2.5 miles for this disappointment. I'm still hungry :(
author: Lukish D.

description: This place is amazing! The food is delicious and the service is great (props to the waiter for singing in Spanish!! Lol) The Hunan butter beef dish and the dry sautéed string beans were our top favorite! Definitely a must!!! The schezuan chicken was really good! For appetizers we got the combo plate which was good! The only thing we weren't a big fan of was the avocado egg rolls. Those we could've done without. Aside from that 5 starts on everything!!
author: Marlo M.

description: I came here after playing tourist at The Palace of Fine Arts. By far the best Chinese take-out. The food is so cheap,  tastey, large portioned, and fast. I ordered the Crispy Dragon Beef ($7.75 for lunch specials comes with soup and white rice) as reccommended by another reviewer, it was a sweet indulgent. I will return if I'm ever in the area!
author: Apple S.

description:
The food was bland. Everything tasted like it had simply been cooked then had the sauce dumped on it. I have serious doubts about this place's authenticity. Please please support the many businesses that do chinese food much better in this city instead.

A theory about chinese restaurants: if it's not someone's name or several words that I don't understand in the name of the restaurant, it's probably not that authentic.

RIP Andy's in the inner sunset. You will be missed.

Also, 3 fortune cookies, one of which was empty, for four people.
author: Marie C.

description:
Welcome to the neighborhood!

I love Chinese food and have been on a search for a decent delivery option. I've tried all of the highly rated places that deliver to my area, which are a lot. Most of them are just not that good, so I had high hopes for this place. 

I was impressed that the delivery came in a reusable bag and even complimented it. Too bad most of the food spilled all over it and I had to throw it out. 

I ordered...

Pork potstickers - tasty, but deep fried, which I'm not a fan of. 

Steamed prawns and veggies - Shrimp was fine and the veggies were nice and crisp and of great quality. Ordered with black bean sauce, which was just OK and a weird consistency. 

Steamed broccoli with chicken - good quality ingredients and well cooked. Ordered with Hunan sauce, which was spicy and a weird consistency.

Hunan eggplant - WAY too much oil. So gross. Too bad, because the eggplant was actually good and very well cooked. Not soggy at all. Saved the leftovers, but probably going to toss. Even though I ordered some healthier options, eggplant is my favorite, so couldn't help ordering it. Big mistake. 

Wonton soup with pork - looks good. Haven't eaten yet. The container top cracked and it was spilled all over the place. 

Combo chow mein - best of all the delivery options I've tried. Would order from here again just for this dish. Hope it's consistently this good.
author: Sharon G.

description: Just love it! Friendly folks, cheap and large portions, tasty and many options. Also super fast to order pickup!
author: Antonio S.

description:
Gross!  Ordered a chicken salad and pork chow mein for to go.  The chicken salad was not what I was expecting at all, and was covered with a pink mayonaise type goop.  It was so nasty looking I threw the entire box straight into the garbage.  Maybe it was delicious, but it looked like vomit.

The pork chow mein was also gross.  Raw red onion.  That's just not right.  Also, loads of undercooked semi-raw bits of garlic.  And the bbq pork was grey and tired.  

These good reviews are very misleading.  This food was straight up nasty in my opinion.  I hate to write a bad review, but I saw all these good reviews and thought I'd give it a try.
author: Zach S.

description: Food comes quickly. Efficient and non-intrusive service. Tasty food. Crispy chicken wings were delicious.
author: Andy L.

description: The staff was friendly and the food was good.  Ideal for a casual dinner for small group looking for good last-minute Chinese food.  The bathroom also smelled really nice. =)  The only con I would really give this place is that the restaurant is a little small and the biggest party that it could serve is probably 1 group of  around 6-8 people.
author: Randy M.

description: Was craving some chinese food so I dropped by to Kung Food last night. The place itself was very cozy on a rainy Thursday night. The food was incredible, and great portions as well. The service was also exceptional. Very friendly and attentive which is always great. I would definitely drop by again when i'm in the area and highly recommend Kung Food.
author: Will T.

description: Great food fast delivery and the guy who delivered was really polite and quick. Great all around and 5 stars!
author: Raynard C.

description:
This is the best restaurant in NOPA. Hands down. This is our neighborhood go to spot. It's not some pretentious spot where people love to tell everyone how long they waited for a reservation, it's just a great restaurant, serving delicious food, run by a guy who always makes you feel welcome. Honestly, it's places like this that create the soul of a neighborhood. 

Tips: Get the shrimp dumplings. Thank me later.
Also, don't know what you want? Ask Andy. He'll guide you to something delicious and sometimes something he just whips up off menu.
author: Josef N.

description:
the general tso chicken was alright. some weird pieces of meat in there

potstickers-good

chow mein- avg
author: Jon K.

description: Delicious and fast Chinese food. We ordered a bunch of vegetable sides to accompany Peking duck we made at home. Everything was delicious, well seasoned and well priced for the quantity.
author: Aida C.

description:
Mu Shu Chicken was tasty and the service was great! I was staring at the Korean chicken wings my neighbor was eating. Looked delicious. 

Updates March, 2018

I love their service but the kitchen doesn't understand our orders sometimes. I come here a lot but last night was by far worst experience I ever had with food. I was too tired to realize the food was not fresh (may be it was microwaved?) and half of my food was filled with semi raw green and purple onions. I thought something was off but didn't know what was wrong. Until I realized got food poisoning. Having major headaches now... my boyfriend is having a stomach issue too...
author: Erena S.

description: Been on the hunt for a go to Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood... It's safe to say I have finally found it! Usually I order form yum yum Hunan, but let's be real, too expensive for mediocre food... After walking by various times, I decided to give Kung Food a try! For my first visit I decided to dine in, and was super pleased with the ambience, and was very very impressed by the service I was given... In ordered the "chefs special A" which was garlic eggplant w chicken AND shrimp! What more could one ask for! Also had the avocado egg rolls! Delish! The owner Andy is super sweet and very attentive to his customers, he seems to recognize his regulars as well which is something that I always appreciate... One thing I will say after reading the other reviews is that, yes, my to go container w my leftovers leaked too.. But I am willing to over look that minor detail! I will be back!
author: Christiana C.

description: Authentic food,  excellent service, intimate atmosphere.  If you desire outstanding Chinese cuisine Kung Food is where you need to be.
author: Sterling B S.

description: Ugh. Best Chinese in the city. Can't get enough. Mongolian beef and combo wonton soup for today's order.
author: Brooke F.

description: Kung food has been a great addition to the neighborhood. We've lacked a good chimes spot and now it's here. With good customer service and solid food you can't go wrong.
author: Raylan W.

description: Best Peking pork chops ever! And right in my neighborhood.  Cheap, good, fast, what more could you ask for?
author: Jennifer K.

description: First time ordering and we got delivery on a Friday night. Don't judge. They said it was an hour wait which was fine because we expected it/weren't that hungry. Boom - 20 minutes later our doorbell rings. WTF?! Open it up (well, the boyfriend does) and the delivery guy APOLOGIZES for how long it took. What they say about the buy 3 get one free thing is real - we got pan fried noodles chicken, Chinese beef and broccoli, pork fried rice and general tsao's chicken - got the fried rice for free. Fed the two of us all weekend. Quality was great and my tummy was happy.
author: Victoria K.

description: 11/10! This little restaurant feels like I'm dining in someone's home-- the setting is intimate, the food is hot and delicious, and the service is so hospitable, friendly, and attentive. I always feel welcomed and appreciated when I eat here. Excellent meatless options too, so vegetarians and vegans take note! There's nothing I don't love about Kung Food! What a geat addition to the neighborhood and San Francisco.
author: Sabrina S.

description: Checks all the boxes for Chinese takeout.  Dishes are appropriately huge.
author: Sam P.

description:
This is by far the best value for a high quality Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. Andy is always both funny and super professional - he adds a lot to the experience beyond the incredibly flavorful food.

Pro tip: order from the Chef's Specials as these are their signature dishes. If you're comfortable with it, you can also ask Andy to order for you...his advice and taste make for great meal exploration!
author: Lee H.

description: Great Chinese Food. I love this place! We ordered oyster sauce beef, chicken with black bean sauce, fried rice, spring rolls and everything was delicious.
author: Mary Ann J.

description:
My wife and I were on vacation in San Francisco and wanted an easy take-away meal, I had my mind set on Chinese food. This place was close to our apartment and highly rated on yelp so we took a chance and ordered. It took me about 20 minutes to walk there and it was ready when I arrived.

The Hunan Buttered Beef was tender, the Walnut Prawns were unique and tasty. For me, the fried rice is the test of a good Chinese restaurant, and this is good fried rice. The food is good, inexpensive and the service is friendly and quick. Be warned, it is only a very small restaurant with about 6 tables that I saw.

Recommended.
author: Chris P.

description: I am usually very stingy with positive yelp reviews and extremely harsh critic of food servers, but Andy, one of the main servers really lights up this small hole-in-the-wall. Great energy, great service, good food. Keep up the good work.
author: Kirill S.

description: I was surprised how good it was...I am a fan.....moist chicken, different take on dumplings but flavorful.  I recommend this place!
author: John C.

description: New addition to the NOPA neighborhood. It's tasty, affordable, and has HUGE portions. Ordered a dish of pork chow mein and the Hanan Crispy Beef (a lot like Panda's Mongolian Beef but better!) for a final bill of about $18.  Food came out quickly and we definitely had leftovers as the two dishes could have fed 3 people. Bonus, they offer to go orders if you call in and will deliver for free.  Definitely, will be back.
author: Tim T.

description: Awesome neighborhood restaurant with great MSG-Free food!  The portions are pretty big and the ingredients are fresh.  It's family owned and they are great!
author: K K.

description: Best Hot and Sour soup I've ever had!!! I am definitely coming back :)
author: Dana C.

description: I tried to love this place but after ordering twice I found it to be just ok. Not horrible but a little bland for my taste. Going to stick with Red Jade and Yum Yum Hunan from now on.
author: Dennis M.

description: Growing up with a mother who is a chef, I learned just how much passion and effort it takes to create a restaurant that attempts to rewrite how a certain type of food is made. My mom rewrote Indian food. Kung Foid rewrites Chinese. Kung Food makes Chinese food with fresh veggies and from scratch. I loved the black mushroom veggie dish we got and the crab Rangoon is fresh and made from scratch. They are generous with their portions. This is why there's a delay on orders. They do need to run their businesses more systematically to handle volume so I hope they'll see that the feedback here at yelp will help them succeed. There's limited seating and they need to get rid of the carpet in the dining room but it's nicely decorated inside. This neighborhood needs restaurants like Kung Food.
author: Priya S.

description: This place is awesome! My and my friends come here often and we order out just as often. The customer service is great and the food is even better!! I highly recommend this place, their noodle dishes are the best!
author: Zoe V.

description:
Small. Fast. Delicious. Clean. Friendly. Cheap. And a clever name as an added bonus. 

We walked in and told the guy working there were needed something fast. "No problem" he said. We sat ourselves down in one of the six (?) tables and ordered. The hot and sour soup came super fast... And was extremely delicious. Meanwhile, the waiter continued to be warm and friendly while our order became increasingly indecisive. In the we ordered General Tsao tofu with mushrooms, Veggie Delight, and Basil Tofu (make it spicy please). The food came out super quick. I loved my General Tsao tofu, the Basil tofu was absolutely delicious, although the veggie delight was a little bland. 

In the end, it was absolutely worth the stomachache. Note: The portion sizes are huge!! We usually don't take leftover food from restaurants, but there was a lot left, and the food was so amazing!

I would surely recommend this to anyone in the Divisadero area looking for quick, delicious food.
author: Anonymous R.

description: Love this place! I have been here a few times because I work right around the corner. Every time I have eaten here the food has been hot and delicious for a great price, and my favorite floaty is that the staff is always so nice! Their dim sum options are delicious! Especially the pork buns! Highly recommend if you are looking for a great Chinese food place with lots of great options and super nice staff!
author: Sally S.

description: Excellent food for the cheap. Love this place, exceptional service and the food is delicious. The Dragon Beef is outstanding, I highly recommend.
author: Brandon E.

description: LOVED this place! You get all the classic Chinese dishes, and the quality of the food itself is terrific! Their Wanton soup was absolutely delicious, the orange chicken was fresh and crispy, with addition small mandarin slices glazed in a terrific sauce, and the chicken lo mein was light and airy with tons of flavor. Definitely visit this place if you're in the mood for classic Chinese!
author: Annie C.

description: I've been here several times and love this place.  All of the staff that work here are amazingly nice.  If you enjoy Pan Fried Noodles, get it on this savory secret.
author: Andrea C.

description: Great food, service, and price. Lunch specials are an especially good value!
author: Bridget W.
