description: My favorite type of food is Asian! So when I heard of this place I was more than happy to come. I come in and we immediately get seated by very nice people. The meal starts with cups of tea. Then u pick out your order and wait. The meals are quite complex but you get your food in less than ten minutes! I was expecting the food that out so fast to be BAD! But it was absolutely delicious! Now for the service and portions. The service was great; the waiter always assisted and got our orders perfectly! The portions were HUGE! I shared my meal with other people and there was still more left. I will be coming her soooooooo much!
author: Brooke T.

description:
Amazing place. This restaurant has the highest quality (without being pretentious) Chinese food we have ever had.  Plus it even has good (no, make that EXCELLENT) service -- a real rarity for Chinese restaurants.  A cute, friendly little neighborhood restaurant.  The owner, Andy, recently opened his own place after leaving Rice and Roll in Pacifica. 

We rarely go to SF other than for business (we live in Silicon Valley and dislike the drive, the congestion and the crowds of SF).  We also rarely eat Chinese food because the service is usually awful. 

On both counts, Kung Food is an exception.  If we lived closer, we would eat there several times a week. Wish they would open up in Silicon Valley!
author: Joe Y.

description: Came in here 40 minutes before they closed and the owner, Andy , was kind enough to tell us that they're closing in 40 min and to place an order soon so that we'll have enough time to sit down and eat. It's a small nice place and the food was really good ! Ordered chicken fried rice and sweet and sour pork. The food came out in a decent amount of time and it was delicious ! The food didn't taste salty , or oily . It was made just right . Shoutout to the owner Andy ! He gave excellent customer service and you can genuinely tell he cares about customer satisfaction. Will definitely come back.
author: P L.

description: My friend Kim suggested we come try this place out, since they just opened up nearby and decided to give this place a try and grab some lunch together. She showed me lunch menu and was surprised by the amount of items listed, that such a place had so many options and decided on the mango beef lunch special. We called ahead and placed an order, since parking there is a hit or miss there. When we got there, we actually found parking and went inside to pick up our orders and asked if it was ok if we ate there even though we ordered to go and they were super nice about it and said it was ok and even gave us silverware and served us tea :) The mango beef was definitely good! I was glad that I could order it without it being spicy. I know at other chinese places, they cannot modify the level of eliminate the spiciness of their food since its premade ahead of time.
author: Julie T.

description: Best Chinese food I have ever had. Great customer service! I will definitely come back again!!
author: Stephy Z.

description: I watched The Search for General Tso on Netflix, then ordered General Tsao's Chicken. It was everything I had imagined.
author: Harold C.

description: I have to be honest - I don't really like Chinese food. And I'm Chinese. However, I did like Kung Food. We got the cumin lamb, rock cod fillet in black bean sauce, sauteed string beans, korean chicken wings, and crab rangoon. My favorite was the rock cod - the flavor was really delicate and the bean sauce wasn't overpowering. The string beans were great - not overlooked and still crunchy. The cumin lamb was flavorful, but could have used more cumin (just my personal preference for cumin). The chicken wings were hot and crispy, and a little sweet. And the crab rangoon was surprisingly good, with real crab bits. Note that the space is tiny - it probably seats about 25 people, so anticipate a wait for dinner time on a weekend. And as everyone has said, the owner is super nice and friendly.
author: E. C. P.

description: Got  food delivered.  Veggies weren't cooked enough.  Bland sauce.  Free fried rice was also bland.  Not enough meatless shrimp in main course.  No fortune cookies.  There's obviously a problem in the kitchen.  Raking in money without delivering proper food is unethical.  Excitement about dinner turned to disappointment.  Got ripped off.
author: Sue T.

description: Excellent and affordable food with generous portion sizes. My personal favorites are the orange chicken and crab wontons. The service has been quick every time I've been here as well. Not overly crowded. Definitely an A+ restaurant.
author: Eric V.

description: I love this restaurant ! As a Chinese I'm usually super picky about Chinese food, this is one of the FEW Chinese restaurants in SF that makes me feel like home. Also the BEST vegan menu I've seen - they use only GMO-free ingredients. Fairly priced, amazing service, this is my new go-to restaurant for sure!!!!
author: Xi C.

description: I am visiting here from the NJ/ NY area, and I am so happy I came across this place! First off, the service is excellent. It is a family owned restaurant that has been in business for exactly one year. All of the siblings work here but the main owner is Andy. He is a sweetheart! He was quick to say yes to any requests we had, he was friendly and very personable. He cared about our experience at the restaurant which makes it even better. The food was also amazing! We had the pork fried rice (add pineapple in it) and it was so good. Not too salty and perfectly cooked. The dragon human beef was AMAZING! It had a little kick to it but if you don't like spice you can handle this (I promise). You can also add broccoli to it which made it more colorful and healthier. The hot spicy homemade pickled sauce is probably the best spicy topping I've ever had in my life. I can't wait to come back here next time I am in the area! Thanks Andy - you rock and good luck with everything :)
author: Deanna M.

description: Over 2 hours 20 minutes waiting for my delivery order. After the first call saying the driver was on his was, I called a second time a 1/2 hour later and said the drive was 5 min away. 20 min later my food arrived. I had asked for chopsticks and extra soy sauce, and that didn't arrive either. The chicken fried rice was so bad I threw it away after a few bites. There are lots of options for Chinese delivery. I won't risk ordering from here again.
author: Glen L.

description: Delicious food and excellent customer service. This restaurant has only been opened for a couple months but has a bright future. Will definitely be going back and will recommend to friends and family. No negatives here just positives trust me you wont regret it.
author: Christian L.

description: Fried foods were mushy, string beans were not seasoned, crab rangoon was baffling and tasted like past-due fish, beef was gray and rubbery, fried rice was just streamed rice with some vegetables and meats thrown on top. I have no idea why this place has four stars and a location on Divisadero. We are not picky eaters, but we could barely touch this crap. And we are definitely not wasteful, but 100% of what we didn't eat that night went straight into the garbage can. So disappointed.
author: Aaron G.

description: Oh, I was served a five star plate of delicious Chinese food on McAllister Street! The service was fast and friendly on opening day, and I liked what they did with the place. They were very welcoming, and I think what sets them apart is how the food looks and tastes more healthy than most other Chinese food places around - tons of low carb options, not greasy, and what I ordered (Basil Eggplant w/Chicken & Prawns) left me full and feeling good. Welcome to the hood and THANKS for bringing Chinese Food to our neighborhood, and not another stinking pizza joint!
author: Alexander M.

description: Great food! Super fast service and the workers were very nice. The dim sum was the best I've had in a very long time.
author: Shalayne W.

description:
I really wanted to like this place... really... 

like most, i ordered my litmus test chinese food...in my case: kung pao chicken (spicy) and vegetable mu shu...

delivery was speedy...like half the time anticipated, so i'll give them that. alright! we're off to a good start! I opened the kung pao, and it looked healthy. The chicken was cut into flattened non-bite-sized pieces and there were hardly any peanuts, there was, however an astounding amount of (red) onions and (green) peppers. I literally think there was an entire red onion in this item, and btw, kung pao doesn't typically even have red onion...I picked out all of the onion (after a first serving not doing so and getting onion in every damn bite), and the green peppers which i don't like to begin with but wanted to see how the kung pao would come without any special ordering. By the time I'd picked out all the remaining onions and the green peppers, it filled HALF of the container it came in. Therefore, i paid almost 10bucks for onions and peppers. Also, the spicy could have been kicked up a notch. I dared not order extra spicy having never ordered from them before, but I'd advise the "extra spicy"if you are going to order from here and want some spice :)

The mu shu was okay, but showed up cold despite the quick delivery. 

I wish I could recommend kung food, but i can't

Guess I'm still on the hunt for good chinese food delivery. I still miss ha's!
author: Wendy X.

description: Excelente Mongolian lamb much better w lest crush peppers my calamari very good on flavor and amount of food b to much green bell pepppers
author: Jose G.

description: Excellent! Quick and very friendly service with really fresh quality food. Beef wonton soup was the best I've ever had and the Snow Pea and Shrimp dish was delic. Lots of vegis! And what a quaint, pretty little restaurant! I think this place is a gem.
author: Chaela E.

description: Kung food is D-vine! I went here because I was craving some delicious Chinese takeout. We ordered Kung pow chicken and Mongolian beef. The man behind the counter was very friendly and told us you get a side of fried rice or chowmein, with purchase of two entrees. AWESOME! The restaurant is very small, so I suggest making a reservation. Everything on the menu is very reasonably priced. I left out 1 star just because there is really no where to wait for your food and it took a lil over 20 mins. Great Gem!
author: Allison W.

description: This place is great! FINALLY an inexpensive delicious chinese food place in the neighborhood! The staff was warm, inviting and was very attentive. The restaurant was nice and clean.  The food was very delicious. If you like San Tung chicken wings then you will enjoy the Korean Chicken Wings. The beef chow mein  wasn't too greasy and the noodles were cooked perfectly. The sesame chicken was nice and juicy with big pieces of chicken. Pot stickers, spring rolls, chicken wings and crab rangoons full of chunks of crab and minimal to non existant cream cheese are all highly recommended. Its nice to find a place that really knows how to make a tasty crab rangoon. I definitely recommend this place and will be going back soon.  I think I might become a regular.
author: Rose S.

description: I ordered from Kung Food online. Prompt, efficient delivery. I ordered: pot-stickers (pork), lemon chicken, sesame beef, and chow mein (beef). Savory, delicious dishes. The delivery man was kindly and able and when there was some confusion, they were good about calling and resolving the issue promptly. I will order again from them as the food quality was very good. Looking for Chinese food with delivery in the NOPA area? Then this is the place.
author: Dennis R.

description:
Basil Beef with Fried Rice.  My favorite dish.
Easy to get to.  Take the 5 muni bus and get off at Divisadero and McAllister St or the 24 muni.
author: Harry W.

description: Outstanding food .....absolutely enjoyed sizzling rice soup w/shrimp & chicken, egg rolls were crisp and fresh, basil beef spicy spicy!!!
author: Jeff H.

description:
Shocked to see all these four and five star reviews. I'm guessing that's the result of one of two things (or both): 1) people seem to be so excited there's finally a Chinese food spot in NOPA they overlooked the process of actually critically considering the quality for the food and went straight to the review OR 2) the people reviewing this place simply have not had top quality Chinese food before.

I agree, the owner is a super cool, friendly guy, but unfortunately that doesn't automatically make the food top quality. Its pretty bland, watery is some cases and just not very tasty unfortunately. I've tried this spot a few different times hoping it would be better but it just hasn't happened, yet. It's certainly NOT BAD Chinese food, its just not very good either.

The Kung Pao chicken, a pretty good benchmark dish, was a perfect example- the large chunks of chicken, veggies etc need to be chopped up into smaller pieces and more importantly the dish needs more taste, better sauce, be less watery etc. Very bland dish. The Orange Chicken was also not very good. Way too bready, weak sauce, not crispy and just poor quality.  

I'm rooting for these guys b/c I live around the corner and I like the owner (and the name of the place) but this is just completely average/below average Chinese food at the moment.
author: Dusty M.

description: Pleasantly suriprised! The name threw me off that it would be tacky Chinese Food, but boy I was wrong! I took-out at around 7pm on a Friday night and the place was packed. Even though it's small, all tables were filled. I also noticed that all of the portions were huge, which was a plus! I got the general tsao's chicken, and it was fantastic! The portions were large which was great, and the chicken was nice and spicy! I was upset that there were only 3 dumplings in an order, but they were large dumplings so I was satisfied! Only downside was that you had to pay extra for rice. However, all in all, great quality/quantity of food for a great price! Would definitely come back!
author: Christy M.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant with friendly service by the owner, Andy.  We really liked the Prawns and mango Singapore rice noodles, Korean chicken wings, and Butter beef.  Portions were humongous for San Francisco.  Will return again!
author: Hugh Y.

description: The owner was nice, the food was delish! I was surprised it was so good, will come back again to try other dishes. :)
author: Peony M.

description: Cozy atmosphere and good food.  We dropped into this neighborhood spot for dinner at 8 pm and were delighted to be served fresh and delicious dinners. My daughter and son-in-law had mango chicken and mango prawns. The vegetables were crisp and the sauce had just the right amount of spice. I had mushu pork and it was the best I've had in years. The pancakes were thin, as they should be, but held together well. My husband had king pao chicken and this was the only disappointing dish. We both wish the ingredients had been cut up into smaller pieces as no knives were provided and both the vegetables and the chicken  pieces were very large.
author: Dorothy P.

description: My favorite American traditional Chinese food. Bold flavors, big portions, very fresh ingredients.
author: Tom V.

description: Great lunch specials; excellent value. Service was fast and friendly. In a neighborhood gentrifying so quickly, it's nice to have a spot that you can make your go to.
author: Nathan Q.

description: Great little neighborhood Chinese restaurant.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Tons of great vegetarian items on the menu.  Vegetables tasted fresh and not too greasy, portions were huge,  prices were very reasonable.  Chow mein, avocado egg rolls, and basil tofu were all excellent.  They are still working out some kinks, but overall, very good food and a great experience.  Definitely coming back - this will be a regular spot for us.
author: Stevan D.

description: I live in the neighborhood and this is my favorite Chinese restaurant. I come here once or twice a week. Good price, delicious and big quantity! Try the dragon beef and the crispy noodle nest! And you can BYOD! The owner Andy is great! He makes us feel so great and comfortable! We absolutely love that place and we really recommend it. They have also a great success and they deliver for free in the neighborhood! I love it.
author: Anne T.

description: Just incredible. Loved the quality and quantity of food for what we paid. Had eggplant chicken shrimp fish, the Dragon beef, wonton soup and hot and door soup--all were delicious. Will be coming back for more very soon.
author: K M.

description: Excellent food and plenty of it. They are very attentive and welcoming of their customers. Be ready to take home leftovers. Next time we are in San Francisco, we will definitely be eating here. Loved it!
author: Christine S.

description: I hadn't even realized our neighborhood was missing a decent Chinese food restaurant until we got one. We visited Kung Food for the first time two nights ago and plan to be back often. We had assumed it would be more of a fast food/to-go joint but when we saw the dining area we decided to eat in. The food was delicious, very reasonably priced, and the portions were sizable. The service was friendly and efficient despite the large volume of to-go orders pouring in. I did not have a single complaint about our meal, so I have to give Kung Food five stars. I wish Kung Food the best of luck and intend to become a regular customer.
author: m t.

description: So happy this place opened just a few blocks from where I live. I ordered take-out and asked if they could stir-fry the orange chicken instead of deep fry. They were very accommodating and it was delicious! Also ordered pork pot-stickers though do wish they were steamed instead of pan-fried. Still tasted good. Will definitely be back.
author: Alana R.

description: Yes! Finally a great Chinese restaurant in Alamo Square/divisadero area! Great Chinese food, very reasonably priced. And the lunch specials are great! Lots of wonderful selections all for around eight dollars and they come with free a eggroll, hot and sour soup, and upgrade to fried rice is only one dollar extra. My new go to spot!
author: Adam B.

description: Great food - very fresh and hot! The pork buns were some of the best I've ever had. The prices are very reasonable, and the service was excellent. I would definitely go back.
author: Jett H.

description: The 4 stars is because the ingredients were really fresh. The fresh veg in the won-ton soup was crisp and delicious. The peppers in the stir fry were the same. Everything seemed less greasy than other chinese places. The slices of pork in the chow mien were luxurious. The dry braised green beans were good too, though I prefer everything a little spicier, so I will tell them that next time that I order. Happy to have a chinese restaurant in this hood. Staff was very nice. Thank you!
author: Andrea F.

description: So happy to have discovered this place. Family run and the staff is wonderful. Food is fantastic. Portions are so large and prices are great. I've tried the combination pan fried noodles, hunan chicken, Mongolian lamb, fried rice-- all of which were fantastic. Highly recommend.
author: Roula C.

description: We just discovered this local Chinese hole-in-the-wall.  It's a great lunch spot.  Our plate lunches fresh, hot, and fast.  Definitely going back.  Friendly service.  Pretty new so the place was neat and clean.
author: Ray L.

description: I live locally and love Chinese but it's always difficult getting all the way down to Wonderland walking from my place. I was pleasantly surprised to see this place pop up. I just had my first meal and I highly recommend the place. Decent amount of fine-in seating, friendly staff, and delicious food.
author: Michael B.

description: This newly open restaurant in NOPA is perfect for those cold San Francisco nights. I ordered the vegetable sizzling rice soup & shrimp dumplings. Both are excellent! The soup is full of zucchini, asparagus, mushroom, carrot & watercress. Yum! Go checkout why everybody is raving about Kung Food.
author: Susan L.

description: I have only eaten take away here but both times the meals were excellent. Impressed by their fresh ingredients, I.e. not frozen vegetables, I had the sesame chicken (ask for it to be crispy!), chow mein noodles and other wonderful rice dishes. The only reason I gave them 4/5 due to the onion pancakes not being crispier. Top choice!
author: Alissa S.

description: Delicious food and great service! They were slammed on opening day... so folks please be patient! worth the wait! owners both Andy and Jaime are AMAZING and super nice and so is the rest of the staff!
author: Kimmy R.

description: Good, decent Chinese food! The portions are a good size and it tastes like it's prepared in a more healthy way than some other Chinese I've tried. As a vegetarian, I can only speak to the veggie dishes, but they're always quite yummy. I often order a dish to go and then make my own rice. One dish can last a few meals!
author: Jessica M.

description: Very disappointed with this place. Read the reviews before ordering from here. You can get better food from the frozen section at Safeway.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I'm so glad this opened up right by my house. As a broke student who never has time to cook, this place is amazing! 
The lunch specials are the best (served 11-3 i think)
you can get a great meal for 7.25 and there is a HUGE selection for their lunch special! I think there is at least 20+ dishes to choose from. Im going to get a different one each day for lunch
The owner is super smiley and nice! 
My new fave Chinese Restaurant. 
Definitely give it a try. I got two dishes from there and the food was flavorful and fresh!
author: Yasaman M.

description: So glad this place opened up near us.  The quality is Delicious, Prices are Incredibly Reasonable, Customer Service is Amazing,  Selection is Fantastic, Environment is comfortable and the Portions and Presentation of the food is Impressive. PLUS they even deliver!  What more could you possibly ask for? It's Absolutley PERFECT!  Our family's new favorite Chinese food restraunt!
author: Davey J.

description: I ordered delivery from them, so I actually haven't been inside. The owner Andy delivered my food, and he was so incredibly nice. I had the mapo tofu, black mushrooms with baby bok choy, and beef chow fun. All were good. They promised delivery in 45 minutes and came in 30 (I am not far, but not super close - if I were, I'd have picked it up myself.) I'll order from them again. It's high time we had a decent Chinese option in the neighborhood!
author: CC L.

description: This is incredibly solid American Chinese food. Not too greasy or salty or dry or sweet, just very well done. Plus service is excellent and very friendly. We had the general Tso chicken and steamed broccoli. Both hit the spot.
author: Fran T.

description: Best Chinese delivery. Friendly & helpful. Fresh food. Colorful veggies. Complex flavors in the basil beef.  If food is love this restaurant is my new romance.  There's an almost magical enjoyment about ordering from them.  The feeling is They Care about food and serving a home-made meal.  I will be working my way through their wonderfully varied menu of items.  Thanks for delivering a delightful meal.
author: Jeff W.

description: I have been going to Kung Food since it opened. We so needed a good Asian restaurant. Kung Food delivered ...its food is authentic and varied.   And the staff including the owner are the friendliest as you can imagine.  I have loved everything I have ever ordered ( about 2x month).  Normally I order pick-up since I only live a block away.   Try it out..you will not be disappointed.
author: michael N.

description:
Don't order through the internet!

I placed an order at 6pm on a Sunday. I called in to verify 10m later and was given a 20 eta.  I arrived at the restaurant waited another 5 minutes to learn they misplaced our order in their dinner rush, and it would be another 20-30 minutes. Seriously.

They offered 10% off the order for a what would end up being a 70-75 total wait. 

With customer service like they will need great food if they are going to last in the neighborhood.
author: Jeff B.

description: Delicious, classic menu. Kind, friendly service.
author: Michelle M.

description: Great place to have Chinese food. Specially the service, it's amazing. I like the vibe the place has, it feels family owned (it actually is). I recommend it!
author: Miguel O.

description: Went here last week and ordered the chow fun.  They accidentally made the wrong dish, but I didn't mind.  The owner apologized and I think even offered to re-make the dish, but the dish they prepared for me instead (chow mein noodles) looked great so I ate it.  As a way of rectifying the situation, they even offered me free green onion pancakes.  The food overall was really great, and I'd come back here again.  You can't beat the prices, and they have lots of vegetarian stuff on the menu too.  Seems like a very well-run, small neighborhood restaurant that cares about their customers.  For what it's worth, the chow mein noodles were some of the tastiest noodles I've had!
author: Zach S.

description: This place is legit. Good quality, good price, good service. Have ordered the Mongolian Beef and Beef in Ginger Sauce. Wish rice came standard though.
author: Matt J.

description: I don't see a "vegetarian's go nuts for this place" sign here but I think there should be. My bf and I used to come here all the time when he lived around the corner, and I was so happy to finally find a Chinese place that had the fake sesame chicken that I love! We usually would go for the lunch specials as you can get a ton of food (enough for leftovers for dinner) for pretty cheap by SF standards. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that sometimes when I went there (and this is a very few compared to the times I loved the place) the food could be disappointing and not as good as I remembered, but the next time I'd go back it was back to being good. So it can sometimes be inconsistent with that, and sometimes the waitress could come off a little withdrawn and rude. Overall, though, these never detracted from my experience, and these weren't the norm so I'd definitely recommend this place!
author: Zoe H.

description: Not sure if the reviewers have any knowledge of Chinese food, but Kung food is not very good. Wanted to have a local go to restaurant, but will need to leave the hood for take out. Sesame chicken was so dry and tough couldn't eat it. Pot stickers tasted doughy. The Mongolian beef was at least edible. Calamari was really bland and the fried rice had no taste. Not up to SF standards.
author: mike w.

description: I have been to this restaurant a couple of times, the food was good but the fruit flies are out of control in the restuarant. So i decided to get take out for lunch instead of fighting off flies the whole time. I ordered prawns and lobster sauce with chow mein...  I got prawns and snow peas with white rice... I hate peas and white rice. Getting one thing wrong was an honest mistake, getting both parts in the order wrong seems intentional. So basically I'll be avoiding this place for now on.
author: Tom L.

description: Great hole in the wall Chinese place. Huge servings, lots of variety, very friendly and extremely quick.
author: Beth B.

description: Ordered delivery and it took about 90minutes but the food was great and it was worth the wait.
author: Chloe C.

description: This place is great.  You get a ton of food for price, it tastes great, and it's not drowning in oil.  I've been here a few times and haven't been disappointed with anything on the menu.  You can tell the owner is passionate about what he's doing and is trying his best to make his customers happy.  He's succeeding.
author: Erik L.

description: This is a great place to eat! I usually go there with my friends and boyfriend. I have been try couples dishes, like Basil lab, chicken wings, garlic spinach, garlic beef and beef with scramble egg. Most of them are very good and tasty.The services are good and friendly as well. Will recommend to my friends.
author: Lisa Y.

description: Newer restaurant, loved the experience. Pan fried noodle for the vegetarians in our group was a huge portion. Veggies were very tasty. Hunan butter beef was the chef special. Steak was seasoned perfectly and very tender. Very friendly service.
author: Rob K.

description: They serve hot tea for everyone which I loved it. The choice for vegetarians were less. The food portion was huge but tasteless. The restaurant was inexpensive relatively.
author: Balaji B.

description: Just had the best beef with vegetables ever!  The Steak was tender and fresh.  The sauce was flavorful and vegetables perfectly cooked. Good clean food!  Yum!
author: Jack M.

description: This place is by far the cleanest Chinese Restaurant I've been to. According to the owner Andy Yang, that his sister Jamie did the interior design all on her own. Never been to a Chinese restaurant that has the ambiance and atmosphere is similar to an Italian Restaurant. Their General Tsao chicken and Hunan Dragon Beef are real tasty, but the dim sum was just average. To my astonishment that the owner Andy Yang is one of the well known Hip Hop artist in the Chinese community. I have been to many of his performances and concerts. It made me feel so special to be served by this genuine and humble Hip Hop Artist. My bestie Grace was in love with the Garlic Lamb and Dry sautéd string Beans, and she was impressed by how profoundly the Chef works with his spices. We ended up taking 5 huge boxes home with honorable Blue Bag. I really wish their place was a bit bigger, so we could stretch out! Good luck Kung Food
author: Yueqi Z.

description: After seeing the great reviews, I decided to finally check this place out the other night. Wasn't really happy with the food. The service and friendliness was great. Everything else was great. Very clean, very tasteful interior. I really wanted to like this place. I wanted to try something really good and was fixated on the Chef's special page for a while. I asked the guy what he recommended. He asked what kind of meat I like. I said chicken or beef preferably. He proceeded to recommend the Chef's special, Butter Beef. I'm not sure why that would be recommended given how unsavory it actually turned out to be. The dish was pretty much just cubed beef with some garnishments that didn't add a whole lot to the dish and the sauce. The actual cut of beef wasn't even remotely good. It tasted to me like a cheap cut of cubed beef marinated with excessive amounts of tenderizer. Tenderizer does not improve the taste of the meat, just makes it soft and that is exactly how it tasted to me. Tasted like super soft low quality beef chunks. The Worcestershire sauce flavor must have only been in the marinade because I didn't pick up on that flavor at all. This dish needs a lot of work if it's going to be the chef special. I may have gotten a poor batch, but I was not impressed at all. Honestly if I wasn't starving at the time and wasn't dining in with a big beer from next door to force the food down with, I probably wouldn't have eaten it. Total came to $20 with steam rice and tip, so not bad if it tasted any good. Also they have beer on the menu but no liquor license so you'll have to go next door to grab your own beer and bring it in. They were very accommodating of bringing in your beer from next door and actually suggested I do that when I tried to order the beer. The other thing I wasn't impressed with was the waiter (probably owner as well), who was very nice, but he consistently tried to predict what I was going to say and say it for me instead of listening. I didn't like that at all. He asked me what I thought of the dish, I said that I liked the sauce but the cut of meat was a bit fatty for my taste and that I'll probably try something else next time. He then said that I probably need well done (it was cooked about medium, which is generally what I like). When I was going to say that wasn't the issue he interjected to say, "you probably like crispy, crispy. Try Beijing beef next time". I thought that was funny because of course no one is expecting tenderloin or top-sirloin at that price point ($13), but if it's the Chef's special, it should probably be a little higher quality so as to be tolerable. Very fatty and unflaverful cut of beef with excessive tenderizer is the only way I can describe it. Anyways, I don't recommend the butter beef chef special. Maybe the other food is much better. I'll likely stick to going to Wonderland for cheap chinese, or Wonderful in Millbrae if I crave the spicy authentic good stuff. My suggestion for the owner if he/she wants to maintain the good ratings established to date; focus on quality and consistency. Don't try to overly impress or try to trick people into a higher opinion of your place. Be open, be truthful. People come for the food, make sure that is consistent and good. Make the adjustments. Don't get greedy Use quality ingredients even if you don't think patrons will notice. Charge a little more for certain dishes if you have to or reduce the portion size. Integrity always pays off in the end.
author: Jeff W.
